programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: The Six Million Dollar Man
programme.desc: Part two. Steve stands in the way of kidnappers who have set their sights on a top presidential aide. Concluding part of the third pilot film, starring Lee Majors

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Three Klingon warriors arrive, looking for Dax's help to track down and kill a man known as the Albino, as an act of vengeance for the deaths of their sons

programme.title: Reign of the Gargoyles (2007)
programme.desc: Second World War American airmen on a mission over occupied Europe are attacked by a horde of mysterious winged monsters. Forced to crash land in enemy territory, they encounter a resistance fighter who reveals that the creatures have been summoned to fight for the Nazis by a sinister ritual, and that the only hope of destroying them is to recover a legendary magical sword. Fantasy adventure, starring Joe Penny and Wes Ramsey

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Rear Window (1998)
programme.desc: A wheelchair-bound architect alleviates his boredom by watching his neighbours in a nearby apartment block from his window. However, when he witnesses a murder he is unable to persuade anyone to believe him and is forced to enlist his girlfriend's help to prove he did not imagine the whole thing. Remake of Hitchcock's thriller, featuring Christopher Reeve's last performance, alongside Daryl Hannah, Robert Forster and Ruben Santiago-Hudson

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Captain Kirk is baffled by the indifference of the planet Organia's rulers to his warnings of an imminent Klingon invasion - and ends up trapped behind enemy lines. William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy and John Colicos star

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Part one of two. Federation rebels are suspected of sabotaging a Cardassian freighter and kidnapping Gul Dukat in protest at a new peace treaty. Sci-fi adventure, starring Avery Brooks

programme.title: The Six Million Dollar Man
programme.desc: A scientist demands $10million after killing the inhabitants of an entire town. First episode of the hit sci-fi saga, starring Lee Majors and Richard Anderson

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: Acts of Vengeance (2017)
programme.desc: A lawyer transforms his body and takes a vow of silence, not to be broken until he finds out who killed his wife and daughter and has his revenge. Drama, starring Antonio Banderas

programme.title: Stephen King's A Good Marriage (2014)
programme.desc: A happily married couple celebrate their wedding anniversary, while the country is plunged into terror by a serial killer with a sadistic tendency to torture his victims before they die. When the husband goes away on business, the wife's cosy world is shattered when she discovers evidence that he is the murderer. Thriller, starring Joan Allen and Anthony LaPaglia

programme.title: The Shed (2019)
programme.desc: Stan, a student living with his abusive grandfather, discovers a murderous creature has taken refuge inside his tool shed. Along with his best friend Dommer, who is being tormented by bullies at school, Stan seeks help from the bloodthirsty creature. Director Frank Sabatella's horror, starring Jay Jay Warren, Frank Whaley and Timothy Bottoms

programme.title: The Taking of Deborah Logan (2014)
programme.desc: Deborah, an elderly woman with an aggressive form of Alzheimer's disease, reluctantly agrees to allow a team of film-makers to document her condition. However, when Deborah begins to exhibit behaviours unusual even for someone with her illness, the crew begins to suspect something much more sinister is happening to their subject. Found-footage horror thriller, starring Jill Larson

programme.title: 2021: War of the Worlds (2021)
programme.desc: Sibling astronomers discover Martians are threatening to invade Earth, but no one believes them until the aliens attack New York. As the siblings try to make it out of the city with their families, they discover the Martians have no immunity against the diseases of Earth, and realise they must work this fact to their advantage. Sci-fi thriller, starring Tom Sizemore, Anthony Jensen and Emily Killian

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: A magnetic force field causes a distortion in space so powerful it threatens the entire universe, and it falls to the crew of the Enterprise to save the day. William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy star

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine

programme.title: Jiu Jitsu (2020)
programme.desc: Every six years an alien species forces an ancient order of jiu-jitsu warriors to come together in order to fight the invaders. The battlefield is destabilized when a celebrated war hero falls in defeat leaving the other warriors on their own. Action sci-fi, starring Nicolas Cage, Alain Moussi, Eddie Steeples and Marie Avgeropoulos

programme.title: Mom and Dad (2017)
programme.desc: A teenage girl and her little brother must survive a crazy 24 hours, during which a mass hysteria of unknown origins causes parents to turn violently on their own kids. Comedy horror, starring Nicolas Cage, Selma Blair and Anne Winters

programme.title: Hellraiser III: Hell on Earth (1991)
programme.desc: A news reporter is locked in a desperate battle with the evil Pinhead, who has taken to plucking victims from a nightclub. Horror sequel, starring Terry Farrell, Paula Marshall, Kevin Bernhardt and Doug Bradley

programme.title: It Follows (2014)
programme.desc: A university student discovers her boyfriend has passed a curse onto her after they sleep together for the first time. It results in her being stalked by a supernatural menace that always seems to be one step behind. Can she and her friends find a way to get rid of it before it finally catches up with her? Horror, starring Maika Monroe, Keir Gilchrist and Olivia Luccardi

programme.title: Treasure Guards (2011)
programme.desc: An archaeologist discovers an ancient scroll revealing the location of the legendary treasure of King Solomon. She joins forces with a member of a secret Vatican organisation to find the ancient riches before they fall into the wrong hands. Action adventure, starring Anna Friel, Raoul Bova and Volker Bruch

programme.title: Doctor Who and the Daleks (1965)
programme.desc: The eccentric time-traveller journeys to the Daleks' home world, which has been devastated by their nuclear weapons. He enters their city and finds them engaged in a plot to exterminate their peaceful humanoid enemies the Thals. Sci-fi adventure based on the TV series, starring Peter Cushing, Roy Castle, Jennie Linden and Roberta Tovey

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: An advertising executive ventures into unexplored regions of the fifth dimension. Ivan Dixon stars

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Dr McCoy travels back in time through a vortex and changes history, stranding the Enterprise crew on a distant planet. Kirk's only hope of rectifying the situation is to follow the doctor and retrieve him before he can do any harm - but in the process he is forced to make a personal sacrifice. With DeForest Kelley and guest star Joan Collins

programme.title: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine
programme.desc: Bashir struggles to save Garak from the addictive effects of a brain implant designed to make the user immune to pain. Sci-fi adventure, starring Alexander Siddig

programme.title: The Six Million Dollar Man
programme.desc: A young woman with ESP abilities helps Steve search the Everglades for a missing scientist. Fantasy adventure, starring Lee Majors and Pamela Franklin

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: The crime-fighter goes undercover in a prison to force a confession from a mobster

programme.title: Mojave (2015)
programme.desc: A suicidal artist drives into the desert seeking solitude, hoping to find some meaning in his shallow life. He meets a mysterious drifter who throws his life off course, and must find a way to conquer his depression in order to protect the things he cares about. Thriller, starring Oscar Isaac, Garrett Hedlund and Mark Wahlberg

programme.title: Revenge (2017)
programme.desc: A hunting trip turns into a nightmare for a couple when two sleazy friends arrive unannounced, setting off a gruesome chain of events. Thriller, starring Matilda Lutz, Kevin Janssens and Vincent Colombe

programme.title: Lake Placid 3 (2010)
programme.desc: Game warden Nathan Bickerman and his family move to the notorious Black Lake, once the site of a deadly spate of crocodile attacks. While the locals assure the newcomers the vicious reptiles are long gone, Nathan's mischievous son discovers a clutch of surviving babies, and as they grow into maturity, they begin to prey on their human neighbours once again. Horror, starring Colin Ferguson

programme.title: Curse of the Crimson Altar (1968)
programme.desc: A man goes looking for his missing brother in a country house, and finds it is home to a decadent society. Troubled by strange hallucinations and the warnings of a mysterious professor, he investigates further, and stumbles on a cult worshipping an ancient witch with human sacrifices. Horror, starring Boris Karloff, Christopher Lee, Mark Eden and Barbara Steele

Emilia Fox and David Caves star, with appearances from Martin Compston (Line of Duty) and Gary Lewis (Billy Elliot)

programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple looking for a home in North Yorkshire on a budget of £300,000, and also joins a hedgerow harvest to fill a basket with berries used for sloe gin

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlotte's old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.desc: The latest updates from the region

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford take a look at the parcel delivery company that's had a rebrand but which viewers say is still not up to scratch. Plus, the families who say they've been let down by the developers who've left playgrounds unfinished and unusable

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda debates fighting for custody of Janine and Mick's baby and Eve goes on a date. Stacey receives another letter from her stalker and Vinny tries to convince Suki to relax. Freddie tries to play matchmaker between Anna and Bobby

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vintage bike restorer Tim Gunn meets 80-year-old Peter Swash who brings in an ancient penny-farthing for him to repair. Having already been patched up 65-years previously when he first got the bike, Peter is hoping an expert can bring it back to life. Betty brings in a battered leather briefcase given to her as a gift for passing her engineering qualification. After spending 65 years using the briefcase while working as the first ever female member of the Institute for Structural Engineers, Betty is hoping master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher can restore the case to its former glory. Steve Fletcher uses his expertise to repair an old clocking-on machine from the British Rail depot in Crewe but the job takes an unexpected turn when he discovers a mystery cog with no obvious place in the mechanism

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk travel to Northumbria to help retired school teachers Mike and Carole declutter their home and raise money for a trip abroad to visit their grandchild. Will quickly gets to work on some furniture in desperate need of a revamp and Christina uncovers several potentially profitable items to take to auction

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd Farm who bought the property despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits the Medway area of Kent in Upnor to see a two-bed terrace with bags of character in a conservation area. Martin Roberts is in Bristol to look around a three-bed semi-detached 1930s build. Dion Dublin heads to Birmingham, where a bathroom from a bygone era catches his eye. They then revisit all three properties once they have been traded at auction and renovated in line with their new owners' wishes

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah heads to Woodbridge in Suffolk to help her buyers channel their get-up-and-go instinct and move away from their quiet hamlet life outside the city of Chester. They have up to £500,000 to spend on a Suffolk town house that can deliver style and kerb appeal. Sailing on the River Deben, exploring Woodbridge's colourful historic streets and visiting its first-rate cinema paint the perfect picture of an attractive town with star quality

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Hobbyist weaver has so far struggled to break into the textile market and mentor Piyush thinks he knows why. Jessica loves colour, but doesn't have a plan of how many she uses in her pieces. Piyush sets her a challenge of using no more than four colours in each of four seasonal collections. Nyanda is a passionate and talented jeweller with a strong design eye, but her business has stalled. Mentor Rachel wants her to make simpler pieces she can produce more quickly and sell for more affordable prices. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: The Repair Shop

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey prepares for a visit from the social workers and advises Eve against seeing Caroline. Alfie struggles to process his recent news when Tommy reveals he saw him heading to the hospital. Bernie's party is a raging success but Bobby worries Anna has feelings for Freddie

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining contenders face three more culinary challenges as they battle for their place in the quarter final. First, The Pairs Challenge sees the celebrities split into two pairs to cook a dish, with only one of the pair given the basic instruction on how to prepare it. Next, the contestants are sent to a professional kitchen during a busy lunchtime service, before facing their final test - the all-new Food Truck Challenge.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

Working alongside an armed team of investigators, on behalf of a local bail bondsman, they hit the streets in pursuit of a violent fugitive, a runaway drug addict and a wanted sex offender

Plus, Kate heads to Koala Creek to be introduced to a bettong and a long-nosed potoroo, two species that have been badly affected by the Australian wild fires but now play a vital role in the recovery of those forests

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Recently diagnosed with autism and dyslexia Shannon has only ever given the hand turned bowls she makes on her incredible foot-powered pole lathe as presents. Dom Chinea and mentor Alice love her work and the way she produces it and want to convince Shannon that she and the bowls she creates are much more marketable than she thinks. Successful musician Ryan wants to quit touring to spend more time at home with his young family and hopes an upcycling business will make that possible. Mentor Zoe can see his work is high quality, but is worried his style doesn't stand out from the crowd

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Visitor Mike presents the engagement and wedding rings he designed for his late wife Sarah. His daughter is now nearing her 21st birthday, and Mike would love her to have her mother's rings as a birthday gift. Goldsmith Richard Talman excels himself to get these broken, bent and faded pieces back to their sparkling best. An old-fashioned penny slot machine and a wooden writing box are also restored

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: After suffering some traumatic events in his life, ex-Royal Air Force aircraft engineer Simon Parker needed a change, so left the mainland to begin a new life as the warden of Flatholm Island. Four miles from Cardiff, in the middle of the Bristol Channel, Flatholm has no mains power or water and is exposed to the worst of the weather. It is a site of special scientific interest because of its gull colony, which makes up 20 per cent of the Welsh gull population and is a crucial breeding ground. As this programme reveals, the more Simon learns about the remote location, the more he learns about himself

programme.title: Question of Sport

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: In the quarter-final, the remaining celebrities cook a two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also previous Celebrity MasterChef finalists Andi Peters, Rylan and Vicky Pattison. The contestants need to pull out all the stops as they try to to secure their place in the semi-finals

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Martin gets into even deeper water with the Slater brothers, while accountant Alan has surprising information for Kath and Diane, providing them with the perfect opportunity to get revenge on the philandering businessman. The first step is for Kath to steal an important document from the office - but when Martin turns up, things don't go exactly as planned

programme.desc: Beth and Eric think Ian is taking them out for a 30th wedding anniversary dinner, but he and Gordon are actually throwing them a surprise party at their house. Ian tries to keep the focus on his mum and dad, but a drunk Cathy treats Eric, Beth and the rest of the guests to a replay of her and Colin's first wedding dance. Comedy, starring Arabella Weir, Alex Norton, Doon Mackichan, Jonathan Watson and Elaine C Smith

programme.title: Heat (1995)
programme.desc: An armoured car hold-up sets a veteran police detective on the trail of a highly intelligent career criminal, whom he is obsessed with capturing. Meanwhile, the robber is planning an elaborate bank heist as his final job before retiring, and a complex game of cat and mouse develops between the two. Michael Mann's crime thriller, starring Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight, Tom Sizemore and Natalie Portman

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits a two-bedroom maisonette in Westcliff on Sea, Essex and Martin Roberts is in Coleford, Gloucestershire to see a flat in need of a real renovation. Dion Dublin checks on the development of a three-bedroom end-of-terrace house in Barlaston near Stoke-on-Trent

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The keepers welcome a new addition to Koala Creek and do everything they can to protect the park from rabies. Kate Humble meets Emma, the archivist in Longleat's stately home, who shares one of the rarest books in the house's collection - a 400-year-old collection of Shakespeare's plays. Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin investigates the native species in the park including various insects, fallow deer and beavers

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Magic realist painter Belinda Eaton depicts an end-of-life care nurse at the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital, who also helps her fellow NHS staff to cope with their own bereavements. Globetrotting painter Belinda credits the experience of always being the outsider in a new place with helping her to develop a unique perspective. How will she go about depicting someone whose working life is spent on threshold between life and death?

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: The endeavours of golden retriever koda, an assistance dog to Mei, who having spent much of her teen years in care suffers from anxiety issues and an eating disorder. Before Koda arrived, 20-year-old Mei was too scared to leave her home, but now they are venturing out together. Koda is prone to falling asleep on the job and has a lot to learn, so Mei has signed them up for further training to help build the confidence she needs to head from Norfolk to London to participate in a function alongside Children's Commissioner for England, Rachel de Souza

programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood samples life working as a game warden in Cameron County, Texas, where he joins warden Mike Gonzalez to learn about the challenges he faces in this role

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A major incident is reported when several canisters containing the deadly chemical weapon mustard gas are dumped in a lake - and the race is on to find them

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell explore the potential of houses in Burton-on-Trent, Burnley and Newcastle-under-Lyme, and chat to the new owners about their plans

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, asking them questions on the specialist subjects of Otto von Bismarck, the history of hand-knitting, Robert Louis Stevenson, and the films of the Coen Brothers, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Southern Brave v Birmingham Phoenix (Start-time 3.00pm). Live coverage of the women's match at Ageas Bowl in Southampton. Brave were runners-up to Oval Invincibles last season, while Birmingham narrowly missed out on the knockout stage after finishing fourth in the table

programme.title: The Hundred
programme.desc: Southern Brave v Birmingham Phoenix (Start-time 6.30pm). Live coverage of the men's match at Ageas Bowl in Southampton. Both teams missed out on the play-offs last year, with Brave finishing seventh and Phoenix fourth, and Birmingham claimed a 53-run victory when the sides met at Edgbaston during that campaign. Will Smeed stole the show on that occasion when he top scored for the Phoenix with a knock of 101 not out from 50 deliveries, while Henry Brookes starred with ball by taking 5 wickets for just 25 runs

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Ahir Shah, Sara Pascoe and Suzi Ruffell join Alan Davies on the panel, as Sandi Toksvig presides and asks questions based, loosely, on the topic of 'sexed-up'

programme.desc: Second of two editions featuring LGBT+ comedians who have appeared on the show, with Tom Allen, Stephen K Amos, Jen Brister, Al Porter, Julian Clary, Suzi Ruffell and Gina Yashere

programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Former care worker Georgie is given the chance to list a £15 million house, but first she has to prove her business credentials to veteran broker Danny. Ex-model Vanesa lands a 15 million euro villa overlooking Monaco, but she needs to sell it before the end of the summer or the owner will take it off the market. With only 10 days to prepare she decides to throw an open house to gain some momentum, but will the bold decision pay off and land her with an offer?

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining celebrities vie for a place in the quarter-final. Split into two pairs, they are tasked with cooking a crowd-pleasing dish that must be identical in both appearance and flavour. Only one team member has the basic instructions of how to cook the dish and has to communicate this across to get the job done. Next, the quartet cook in a professional kitchen for paying customers during a busy lunchtime service. The third and final test sees the MasterChef Kitchen transformed into a street food market, with the celebs cooking a dish that they would serve from their own dream food truck

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Reality challenge in which eight aspiring wedding planners battle it out to become the best in the business, with six brave couples letting them take control of their big day. The competition gets off to an explosive start as the planners transform an industrial Concorde hangar under the watchful eyes of judges Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: Despite a UK-wide recruitment crisis, the chef discovers how some businesses are finding clever ways to build and retain strong, effective teams. One example is found in London's Docklands and an innovative floating hotel. The owners are pioneering an on-the-job training scheme designed to help local unemployed people take their first steps into hospitality

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Scott Smith demonstrates how to prune a rambling rose, while Kirsty Wilson checks up on her hot border, designed to be a riot of colour in high summer. Calum Clunie is at his allotment in Leven, where he's planting potaoes he will serve up for Christmas dinner

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The team celebrate the wild stretch of water that is 'half mile lake' which is home to Californian sealions, African hippos and native beavers with gorillas and monkeys living on the banks. Hamza Yassin is given special access to the park after the visitors have gone home so he can capture some of the wildlife living in the lake. Kate Humble joins the vets as they check up on Wilma the cheetah who has kidney disease. Megan McCubbin visits Chico the sloth to ensure the conditions in his enclosure match the ones he would be used to in the wild

programme.title: What They Really Mean For You
programme.desc: Justin Rowlatt, Michelle Ackerley and Dr Tara Shine investigate the eco-friendly alternatives to oil and gas boilers and if it's possible to build an entirely low-carbon electricity network before the government's net zero target of 2050. Justin explores a futuristic house in Salford that is used to test new heating technologies in extreme conditions. Michelle gets an insight into how heat pumps are installed and the cost of doing so. Tara meets the gas company promoting hydrogen as the solution to home heating and finds out if it is a feasible option

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the first semi-final of the quiz, inviting four returning contenders to brave the black chair once more. They answer questions on the specialist subjects of the Booker Prize, the city of York, the Busby Babes, and the Russo-Japanese War, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: In Norfolk, IT man Dominic faces off against train driver Martin. Paul Martin teaches them the tricks of the trade and turns them into successful antiques dealers

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining chefs from Wales try to impress judges Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton, who are joined on the panel by musician JB Gill, once of boy band JLS. They are competing to cook at the final banquet, which takes place this year at Abbey Road Studios to mark 50 years since the Beatles played live together for the last time

programme.title: Beechgrove Repotted
programme.desc: The team combines sustainability with staying on trend, with Kirsty Wilson demonstrating how to create a living herb wall made out of recycled materials

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his search through the National Archives, unearthing the secret documents that show why Britain didn't boycott the Berlin Olympics of 1936. He also looks at files revealing Churchill's attempt to ban the world's first black heavyweight boxing champion, and a royal proclamation outlawing football

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: Spot and Stripe are outgrowing Giles Clark's home and developing adult behaviour, so the time comes for them to be reintegrated with the rest of the tigers at Australia Zoo. Their development is far from over, however, as they have their first swimming lesson and meet the adults they are going to share their lives with. But all is not well with Spot, who picks up a life-threatening eye condition

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Charles Hanson are in Margam Country Park in south Wales to value items brought in by the public, while presenter Paul Martin finds out about the link between the estate and the nearby Port Talbot steelworks

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Young farmer Katie parades her Jersey cows, along with sibling duo Beth and Luke and their Limousin cattle, all pinning their hopes on winning at Wensleydale Agricultural Show

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Goat farmer Liz started her own pedigree dairy herd while raising two children and working in healthcare. Now she hopes to bag some rosette wins to boost her milk and cheese business. Welsh pony farmer Kitty is the third generation to care for this breed and wants to maintain the family reputation as a top breeder. The two take their animals to the Royal Welsh Show looking for success

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the wild and rugged coast of Cumbria and learns how central the county is to many of the challenges facing Britain. He visits Sellafield, which is home to hundreds of ageing and disused nuclear facilities and meets people tasked with clearing and securing more than half a century of Britain's nuclear waste

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: Tom meets trailblazing operators who are risking everything to redefine the British pub, while trying to navigate the cost-of-living crisis. They include siblings Josh and Holly Eggleton, who used the pandemic to refurbish their Somerset pub the Pony Chew Valley, and have reopened it as a restaurant, cookery school and wedding venue. But when Tom hears how much they are in debt he worries that the siblings have bitten off more than they can chew

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a huge vacuum cleaner factory in the heart of Somerset, where over a million vacuums are made every year. Here, he follows the production of their biggest seller, the bright red Henry hoover. Elsewhere, Cherry Healey puts the contents of her vacuum bag under the microscope to see what is lurking in her home's dust

programme.title: No Activity
programme.desc: Stokes and Hendy find themselves sitting in an empty dockyard watching shipping containers, but an over-eager security guard disrupts the operation. Jimmy finds himself with a new partner after Bruce gets himself injured

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: Ehiz, one of the UK's biggest social media stars, breaks down his own experiences of toxic masculinity and challenges how society defines gender and identity through this sick grime track. Look sharp for a Pomeranian, powdered wig, Celine heels and his balaclava wearing siblings helping to hammer this uber important and timely message home

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Brock and Kristi struggle to get on the same page, Orna helps Josh to make a connection between his past and present and Nadine comes clean about her feelings for another lover

programme.title: Ultimate Wedding Planner
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix, Sara Davies and Raj Somaiya continue the search for someone skilled enough to launch their own wedding planning business. Rivalries grow and tensions rise as the planners have three days to create a sustainable, farmyard festival wedding for one couple and their 94 animals - and it's the final straw for one fledgling planner

programme.title: Crazy Rich Agents: Selling Dream Homes
programme.desc: Five rookie property brokers drawn from all walks of life compete in the world of luxury real estate, with the winner being given the opportunity to work at an agency's headquarters in New York. Aly takes up the challenge and hustles to get a meeting with a multimillionaire developer, who he boldly persuades to let him list a £30 million town-house in Mayfair, while former care worker Georgie is given the task of finding a dream home for an influencer couple

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining celebrities take part in their final challenge, for which they cook a two-course meal that will be judged not only by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also by former series champions Lisa Faulkner (2010), Phil Vickery (2011) and Kadeena Cox (2021). The person judged to have provided the best offering will go through to the semi-final, while the others will be heading home

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and new co-presenter Rob Rinder go behind the scenes at some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world. Their first stop is Richard Branson's remote clifftop Kasbah Tamadot in Morocco, where they work alongside the staff to discover the significance of Berber hospitality, food and culture to their guests

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits the Medway area of Kent in Upnor to see a two-bed terrace with bags of character in a conservation area. Martin Roberts is in Bristol to look around a three-bed semi-detached 1930s build. Dion Dublin heads to Birmingham, where a bathroom from a bygone era catches his eye. They then revisit all three properties once they have been traded at auction and renovated in line with their new owners' wishes

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble shares 'prey-eye view' footage featuring a pride of lions. Hamza Yassin attempts to befriend a kangaroo, known as Brave, who is notoriously nervous around men

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team celebrates people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty Don shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of the bargain plants available at this time of year. Joe Swift visits a community food-growing project in Bristol. And Rachel de Thame meets a cut flower-grower who started her own flower farm with no prior knowledge of growing

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Seventeen contenders start this edition of the quiz, but how many of them will survive to face the £10,000 Question? Hosted by Rick Edwards

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys hosts the second semi-final of the quiz, with four more returning contenders answering questions on the specialist subjects of films based on the works of Stephen King, Joan Rivers, US state capitals, and Neil Gaiman novels.

programme.title: Make Me a Dealer
programme.desc: The antiques-buying challenge reaches Derby, where Paul Martin teaches Kate Dumelow and Lucy Foster-Brown the tricks of the trade to see who can make the most profit

programme.title: Best Bakes Ever
programme.desc: Actress and cake expert Jane Asher presents another selection of recipes from TV chefs, including the likes of James Martin, Mary Berry, Paul Hollywood, the Hairy Bikers, Raymond Blanc, Nigella Lawson, Tom Kerridge, Lorraine Pascale and Rachel Khoo

programme.title: Portillo's State Secrets
programme.desc: Michael Portillo looks at files from the National Archives that relate to traitors and spies, including documents that show a king's role in torture and James Bond's secret wartime origins. He also learns how a double agent's escape at the height of the Cold War was a comedy of errors

programme.title: Tigers About the House
programme.desc: First of a two-part programme catching up with zookeeper Giles Clark and the Sumatran tiger cubs he was hand-rearing in his home in the suburbs of Queensland. Spot and Stripe are approaching their first birthdays and Giles has his hands full guiding them from adolescence into adulthood, while Spot faces uncertainty about his eyesight and his relationship with Stripe. The Clarks also make a big decision to safeguard the cub's wild cousins, with Giles, his wife Kerri and son Kynan embarking on a road trip through Indonesia with the aim of helping to protect endangered species

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Powderham Castle in Devon, which dating back to the 14th century, is the long-standing home of the Courtenay family. Antiques experts Claire Rawle and Mark Stacey find great treasures among hundreds of visitors to the stately home. Claire meets a steam train fan with a great collection of memorabilia, and Mark gets a surprise when an art deco Spanish bracelet goes under the hammer. Paul also delves into the history of the Met Office

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farming couple Sarah and Richard proudly own a flock of rare Lincoln Longwool sheep, but will it prove to be sufficient competition for Martyn and Sadie's at Lincolnshire's Heckington Show?

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Dorset farming couple Richard and Sophie milk their herd of almost 400 dairy goats every day, but the raw ingredient isn't enough to turn over a profit. To drive their small business forward, they have started to make goats milk ice-cream and are on a mission to convert the public's tastebuds to their alternative to cow's milk. Armed with their range of tempting flavours, they attend the Gillingham & Shaftesbury Show. It's also an important day for young couple Tom and Emily, who are on a sales mission with their organic beef

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Ben Robinson explores Parkgate on the estuary of the River Dee, Cheshire. The village is landlocked due to the estuary's shifting silt, but 250 years ago it was a bustling harbour

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter and Calum Clunie reap the results of the planting from earlier in the year. The windowsill tomatoes are in full fruit and Carole harvests the blooms planted in the spring to be dried and used for flower arrangements. Calum sows a selection of vegetables ready for the winter and there's a report from a community garden in the Cranhill area of Glasgow

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants for pollinators in the wildlife garden, takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer vegetable harvest. Carol Klein visits Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire and Rekha Mistry reveals the latest triumphs and disasters in her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: The Real Peaky Blinders
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian Carl Chinn explores the real-life stories of the Birmingham gangs that inspired Steven Knight's hit BBC drama, sorting out the fact from the fiction. The programme begins by examining the origins of the phenomenon in Birmingham, from the first mention of the term Peaky Blinders in the popular press in 1890 and the street gangs that stretched back into the Victorian era as far back as the 1860s, when they were known as slogging gangs

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob venture to the west of Ireland to fish the mighty Lough Corrib, regarded as one of the best places in the country to try trout fishing. They head out on boats and try out a new technique called dapping, with local guide Richie Johnston providing much-needed assistance, and also helping them in their quest to find out what exactly the 'craic' is, where to find it and how to experience it

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Rob Rinder travel by seaplane to go behind the scenes of Joali hotel resort in the Maldives, which offers guests a luxury experience despite its remote location. Rob discovers there are 300 workers hidden in the centre of the island, while Monica finds out how food is supplied to the island chefs. They realise that delivering paradise is like a giant theatre production

programme.title: The Hidden World of Hospitality with Tom Kerridge
programme.desc: Tom meets trailblazing operators who are risking everything to redefine the British pub, while trying to navigate the cost-of-living crisis. They include siblings Josh and Holly Eggleton, who used the pandemic to refurbish their Somerset pub the Pony Chew Valley, and have reopened it as a restaurant, cookery school and wedding venue. But when Tom hears how much they are in debt he worries that the siblings have bitten off more than they can chew

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Lara Lewington speaks to some of the so-called godfathers of artificial intelligence about their hopes and fears for the future of a technology many believe could pose an existential threat to the human race. She also talks to researchers developing technology that allows computers to read human emotions and thoughts

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: With the help of her peers, Dr Orna Guralnik shifts her methods with Sean and Erica, while Brock reveals a childhood wound. Nadine and Christine attempt a new relationship dynamic

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect
programme.desc: Fiona and Andy moved into their 300-year-old Solihull barn conversion a year ago, but it's not quite the fairy tale they imagined. The barn has a major identity crisis - with dated decor, a dark and poky stable conversion, a cut-off central courtyard and a 1980s extension tacked on the end. To add to their woes there's a spiral staircase right in the middle of the living room. Enter architects Laura Jane Clark and Julian McIntosh, who come up with alternative VR solutions to the couple's property problems - only one of which they can make a reality. Presented by Angela Scanlon

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he finds out how, in the 19th century, the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable and how the river is maintained today

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The classicist takes a look at the history of the ancient city, putting aside the bloody stories of emperors and armies to learn about the ordinary Roman on the street. Her travels take her from the Via Appia roadway, originally built in 312 BC, to the Colosseum and Monte Testaccio, an artificial hill made of broken crockery. Along the way, she tells the stories of a slave-turned-baker who made a fortune out of the grain trade, building his tomb in the shape of a giant bread-oven, three prisoners of war and a purple-dye seller whose raw material was imported from Tunisia

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: Drama-documentary that uses the Colosseum to tell the thrilling story of the rise and fall of the Roman Empire, through the lens of the men and women who fought and died there. Featuring interviews with leading historians, the episode uses striking re-enactments and special effects to infuse excitement into the personal narrative of each character

programme.title: Colosseum
programme.desc: When master builder Haterius constructs the Colosseum from the ashes of Nero's Golden House, his work is far from over. New Emperor Domitian tasks him with adding in a complex network of underground tunnels - the hypogeum

programme.title: Sir Derek Jacobi Remembers - I, Claudius
programme.desc: The veteran actor looks back at the 1970s drama, based on the novels of Robert Graves, telling the life story of a reluctant Roman emperor

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Acclaimed drama set amidst a web of power, corruption and lies, chronicling the reigns of the Roman emperors - Augustus, Tiberius, Caligula and finally Claudius - focusing on the intrigue that surrounded their respective reigns. Augustus's wife Livia schemes to ensure her son Tiberius succeeds her husband. The dispute between Marcus Agrippa and Marcellus reaches boiling point, prompting the former to leave Rome for the East. With Derek Jacobi, Sian Phillips, Brian Blessed and George Baker

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: Augustus refuses to forgive Tiberius, but remains blissfully unaware of Julia's philandering. Lucius is promoted to command the army in Spain following the inexplicable death of his brother

programme.title: I, Claudius
programme.desc: A marriage is arranged for young Claudius, while Livia, wife of Emperor Augustus, plots against his daughter Julia and manages to convince him to bring her son Tiberius back from exile so he may assume the throne. As Julia is banished, stumbling, stuttering Claudius finds a friend in Herod, king of the Jews. Derek Jacobi, Sian Phillips and George Baker star

programme.title: Meet the Romans with Mary Beard
programme.desc: The classicist takes a look at the history of the ancient city, putting aside the bloody stories of emperors and armies to learn about the ordinary Roman on the street. Her travels take her from the Via Appia roadway, originally built in 312 BC, to the Colosseum and Monte Testaccio, an artificial hill made of broken crockery. Along the way, she tells the stories of a slave-turned-baker who made a fortune out of the grain trade, building his tomb in the shape of a giant bread-oven, three prisoners of war and a purple-dye seller whose raw material was imported from Tunisia

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: An investigation into the science of black holes and the techniques being used to uncover their secrets, which in turn help to answer even bigger questions about the universe

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Milwaukee, a city on the shore of Lake Michigan, where he learns about the history of the iconic American Harley Davidson motorcycle. When Michael reaches the city of Illinois, he discovers how the modern day skyline of Chicago has replaced a largely wooden city which was destroyed by a great fire many years ago

programme.title: How We Tamed the Cat and Dog
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary examining archaeology and genetics to answer questions about cats and dogs, including where they came from and how they ended up living with humans. This first edition focuses on the dog, revealing that the emotional bond between human and canine is so profound that it is helping transform the lives of hardened criminals in the US prison system convicted of the most violent crimes. The programme also hears from Callie Truelove, a girl living with the rare genetic condition Williams syndrome, which makes her extremely loving and sociable. Geneticists have discovered that the same mutations that give Callie her super social nature have also been found in dogs. Narrated by Mark Benton

programme.title: The Deer Hunter (1978)
programme.desc: The lives of three American steelworkers and their families are torn apart in the wake of the Vietnam War. After enduring horrific treatment in a prison camp during the conflict, the three friends return to their homes but struggle to readjust to normal life. Oscar-winning drama, starring Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, Meryl Streep, John Savage and John Cazale in his last film role

programme.title: Cape Fear (1991)
programme.desc: A psychopathic rapist is released from prison after 14 years and plots revenge on the defence attorney he blames for his imprisonment. Subjecting the lawyer and his family to a terrifying campaign of intimidation, he uses his knowledge of the law to stay untouchable. Martin Scorsese's thriller remake, starring Robert De Niro, Nick Nolte, Jessica Lange and Juliette Lewis, with cameo appearances by Gregory Peck, Robert Mitchum and Martin Balsam, who all appeared in the 1962 original

programme.title: The RKO Story: Tales from Hollywood
programme.desc: Ed Asner examines the paranoia created by the House Committee on Un-American Activities and Edward Dmytryk and Richard Fleischer explain film noir. Plus, footage of Robert Mitchum making his first screen appearance, and a look at Val Newton's films Zombies and Cat People

programme.title: Sir Andras Schiff at the Proms
programme.desc: Celebrated pianist András Schiff plays Schumann's Piano Concerto at the BBC Proms alongside the world-famous Budapest Festival Orchestra and their founder-conductor Ivan Fischer. The Schumann is bookended by the overture to Der Freischütz by Weber and Mendelssohn's Scottish Symphony, which was inspired by a ruined chapel echoing with the ghost of Mary, Queen of Scots. Clive Myrie presents, and is joined by Joanna MacGregor

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Gary Davies and Bruno Brookes present the programme, first broadcast on August 21. Featuring Depeche Mode, Prince and the Revolution, Bruce Hornsby and the Range, Modern Talking, Boris Gardiner and the Communards

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Noel Edmonds presents the edition from August 17, 1978, with music by Boney M, the Stranglers, Justin Hayward, Child, Darts, the Who, 10cc, Mr Big and the New Seekers. Plus, a performance by dance group Legs & Co

programme.title: BBC Four Sessions
programme.desc: The American blues singer performs in concert at Stoke Newington Town Hall in north London, featuring tracks from across her career, spanning from the self-titled 1971 debut album to her April 2012 release, Slipstream. The set includes her signature tunes, Love Has No Pride, Nick of Time, and Love Me Like a Man. She is joined on stage by regular collaborator Paul Brady

programme.title: Judy Collins: In Concert
programme.desc: The Seattle-born singer, known for her soprano voice, performs to a BBC studio audience in a concert recorded during a 1974 tour of the UK. Songs include Both Sides Now and Chelsea Morning

programme.title: Joan Baez: In Concert
programme.desc: Part one of two. Folk singer Joan Baez performs live at the BBC Television Theatre in 1965. Songs include Rambler Gambler, Don't Think Twice, It's All Right and We Shall Overcome

programme.title: Joan Baez: In Concert
programme.desc: The conclusion of Joan Baez's performance at the BBC in 1965. Songs include Silver Dagger, It Ain't Me, Babe and Isn't It Grand, Boys

programme.title: Newsround

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings organize wrestling combats on the living room couch. Grizzy, weary of the clamor, stops the match. The displeased Lemmings retaliate, but during their fight the cabin's wood floor caves in and they all fall into an old sidecar with four wrestling masks inside. Grizzy, two Lemmings and a partridge launch into a pitiless combat.

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: After a spat over a jar of Yummy, Grizzy and the Lemmings find gold leaf-wrapped chocolate bits scattered in the jungle. Delicious! On the backs of a bat and a tapir, the rodents and the bear fight over the harvest of candy

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: Three villains team up with Bonnie Blaster and her high-powered, oddness-causing gadget.

However, Omari, Kiara and Mahkai need to solve a series of riddles she has left in order to discover exactly what this surprise is. This is easier than it sounds, as Big Granny is tricksy and has more than one trick up her sleeve. Can the McQueen siblings solve Big Granny’s mysterious riddle trail?

programme.title: Grizzy and the Lemmings
programme.desc: He is big as a bear, strong as a bear, smart... as a bear. No other animal dares to contest Grizzy. Except the lemmings…

programme.title: Deadly 60
programme.desc: An exotic pet is something that is slightly different from your average cat, dog or hamster and is often an animal from a far-flung place. Steve has kept snakes, spiders and scorpions all his life and thinks it is a great way of learning about the natural world. The problems begin when those pets come from uncertain places. The illegal pet trade can result in animals being taken from the wild, with devastating consequences. In this episode, Steve runs through his tips for what we can all do to try and stop it.

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Nigel and Baby Bear welcome little ones Minnie, Luna, Oliver, River, Theo and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Nigel’s bag are a toy pig, a toy sheep and a toy chicken, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that are themed around things you might find at a farm. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate farm objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The fun song Old MacDonald Had A Farm features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring farm things too. The Together Song gets everyone moving about before some calm time with sensory scarves and the Goodbye Song.

Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Carlson’s questions. programme.title: Our Family

programme.title: Maddie, Space and You
programme.desc: Join Maddie as she discovers that astronauts live in space on a spacecraft called the International Space Station and that there have been different astronauts living there for over 20 years. Maddie shows us how astronauts live and work on the International Space Station and do lots of different jobs and research in order to learn more about space and our planet Earth. We explore a laboratory where they do experiments, the food they eat, how they wash and even how they go to the toilet. We find out that the space station is made from thousands of parts that were put together by astronauts in space, and we learn that it’s also a home because it’s a place where astronauts eat, sleep and have fun.

programme.title: Get Set Galactic
programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, they must work out if an object is heavier or lighter than another before placing it on a giant set of scales. Then, there’s a fast-paced game based on personal hygiene, where the young scientists must race against the clock to brush as much food as possible off giant teeth. Finally, the teams dress as bees with sticky legs to transfer pollen between giant flowers. Plus, it’s Sam’s birthday, and Ayo has given him a coded message made up of strange symbols. Can he crack the code to reveal a big surprise?

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred is finding that treasure-hunting when you’re hungry is really hard. However, that doesn’t stop him and Pete finding a long, black and white-striped metal cone in the sand. They know it's treasure, but what kind? Suzy quickly identifies that it’s a horn that makes a loud noise. Suzy sends the boys off to a fishmonger, where Kay points out that the horn is a huer’s horn used to helped fishermen find fish. But how could blowing a horn help anyone find fish? Suzy rings on the Treasure Comm and directs Fred and Pete to visit a huer’s hut on the cliffs above Newquay. There, they meet Karl, who explains that the horn was blown to indicate that the huer had seen some fish. Karl then shows Fred and Pete how the huer would use signals to get the fishing fleet into position. Fred and Pete decide to put this to the test. Unfortunately, the wind and a swarm of bees play havoc with Pete’s directions, but Fred somehow ends up back in the fishmonger, where he buys some Cornish sardines. Suzy ring

We discover there are lots of different types of space robots, robonauts that help astronauts to do jobs, space probes that travel to far off parts of the solar system, and landers and rovers - robots that land on planets like Mars to collect information. We learn how robots are sent on special missions to Mars and how they take pictures and send information back to Earth. Maddie visits a research centre to meet a Mars rover robot and uses her special cameras to help us see how it moves over the ground.

programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, the teams must guess which animals Sam and Ayo are looking at through their telescope based on a series of clues. Then, in a game based on light and shadows, the young scientists have to figure out what their team captains are holding by observing their shadows behind a huge screen. Finally, the teams must take items from a giant conveyer belt and sort them so they can be reused and recycled. To make it even trickier, the players are attached to bungee cords! programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: Fred and Pete are walking across some moorland close to one of Cornwall’s many ancient stone circles, when they come across a mysterious blob of metal. But what is it? After many failed guesses, they decide to take the metal blob to the museum. Suzy and Archie recognise that the metal blob is made of bronze, an important metal in early Cornish history. Thousands of years ago, bronze was used to make tools all over the county during a period called the Bronze Age. They meet archaeologist James, who explains how the discovery of bronze allowed people to make tools that were stronger and faster than the stone tools used before. Suzy rings them on the Treasure Comm to tell them how Bronze Age people used to live in what are called round houses. She sends them to one nearby to find out exactly what life was like back then. After changing into some Bronze Age clothing, Fred and Pete check out the round house and discover that Bronze Age people were kept very busy with simple, everyday tasks

She tries on a real spacesuit and learns about the types of spacesuits they wear to do different jobs. Maddie discovers astronauts need to be fit, healthy and have good agility. programme.desc: The potatoes sing a guitar-driven rock 'n' roll anthem celebrating their feelings
