programme.desc: Andy works at Safari World, the biggest and best safari park on the planet, home to animals from all over the globe. He works there with his boss, Mr Hammond and tech wizard Jen

programme.title: Get Set Galactic
programme.desc: Two teams touch down at the STARS space station to take on three scientific challenges to win out-of-this world prizes. First, they must guide magnetic rockets out of the Magnet Maze, dodging comets and stars along the way. Then, the teams must work out which season James is talking about by standing under the correct tree. If they’re correct, they’ll get covered in spring blossom, summer sunlight, autumn leaves or winter snow! Finally, a player from each team must memorise a pattern of animals on the Memory Path, before guiding their partner across it. In the lab, Sam, Ayo and James complete a quiz to find out which animals they share qualities with. But who is the eagle, the herring gull or the dung beetle?

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The dog blows a lot of bubbles with his pot of bubble mixture. Though it is quite hard to do, most of the squirrels eventually get the hang of it and the clubhouse rapidly fills up with lots of bubbles

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: When Mr Tod and Sammy Whiskers team up to strike the rabbits' big picnic, Peter must team up with the only rabbit who can match him for speed and cunning - his mom

programme.title: Fred & Pete's Treasure Tales
programme.desc: As Fred and Pete try to pluck up the courage to paddle into the sea, Pete discovers an object covered in sand and shells. But what is it? They head to the Museum of Cornish Treasures to see if Suzy and Archie can help. Here, Fred and Pete find out their treasure is a special mirror connected to a magical legend of the sea. But who would need a mirror in the sea? Suzy knows of a Cornish legend that might provide an answer and sends Fred and Pete off to a church in the village of Zennor. There, they meet Elizabeth, the vicar, and find a carving of a mermaid holding a mirror just like theirs. Elizabeth tells them that mermaids are said to use mirrors when brushing their long hair, and that Cornwall has many mermaid legends. Fred and Pete decide that maybe the mirror belongs to the Zennor mermaid and want to return it. But how do you meet a mermaid? Suzy buzzes on the Treasure Comm and tells Fred and Pete that, according to the legend, the Zennor mermaid loved the sound of singing. Fred an

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.desc: Barnacles and Kwazii sneak into a walrus colony to retrieve Peso's medical kit

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey has to appease invisible mischief-making fairies, who have infested the house.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Two babysitters turn up to look after Bluey and Bingo!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea tricks Supertato into thinking he has lost his powers

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: The team goes in search of a mysterious new creature on the Academy Island

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: The bunny tells a curious Cotton-tail how he and Squirrel Nutkin became friends, and ends up going on a quest to Owl Island to retrieve his pal's tail

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Chloe has some new glasses to wear, however her new look is confusing Topsy.

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: Duck sees some flying, migrating ducks in the sky and decides he would like to try it too

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo's excited to go on her first camping trip with Gran Gran, Cousin Lexi and Uncle Tyrell. It's JoJo's first time sleeping outside! JoJo and Lexi help put up the tent and try to decide what they love about camping. After going for a walk through the forest and spotting a stag, they light a fire for dinner with collected wood, before enjoying a campfire tea of soup and yummy toasted marshmallows. After dinner, they get into their sleeping bags to look at all the stars in the sky. The next morning, JoJo decides what she loves most about camping - sleeping outside with the stars

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion is interrupted by Little Nana and Lambkin, playing a noisy hopping game

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Tiny and Small accidentally spill green soup all over Granny's best shawl, and when they ask Cloud and the froglets to help them clean up the mess, things only end up getting worse

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: The Tombliboos hear Igglepiggle's musical stepping stones and Upsy Daisy's singing

programme.title: Hushabye Lullabye
programme.desc: The Chumbles bumble along, making dreamy patterns and shapes for Dillie Dally to explore.

programme.title: CBeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Helen George reads Held in Love, a story about a mother's hopes and dreams for her new-born baby!

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison explores the powers of the great outdoors to provide a tonic in troubled times as she immerses herself in nature, from forest bathing to wild swimming. There are also films from the Countryfile archives about the health-giving prowess of the UK's green havens, including John Craven finding out how nature helped heal wartime wounds, and Anita Rani visiting a special farm giving respite to refugees

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v England (Kick-off 11.00am). Coverage of the second semi-final, which comes from Stadium Australia in Sydney. The co-hosts edged out France on penalties in the quarter-finals, while England came back from behind to prevail 2-1 against Colombia

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The team celebrate the wild stretch of water that is 'half mile lake' which is home to Californian sealions, African hippos and native beavers with gorillas and monkeys living on the banks. Hamza Yassin is given special access to the park after the visitors have gone home so he can capture some of the wildlife living in the lake. Kate Humble joins the vets as they check up on Wilma the cheetah who has kidney disease. Megan McCubbin visits Chico the sloth to ensure the conditions in his enclosure match the ones he would be used to in the wild

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple looking for a home in North Yorkshire on a budget of £300,000, and also joins a hedgerow harvest to fill a basket with berries used for sloe gin

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlotte's old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food market in Hay-on-Wye, getting tips on home growing and finding out the secret to making fudge. Onkar Singh Purewal is in Cardiff to discover how setting up a food stall has provided a lifeline for some in the community, and in Ceredigion he discovers the key to making sourdough bread. Farmer Meinir Howells gets to grips with turning rapeseed into oil in Ruthin

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda debates fighting for custody of Janine and Mick's baby and Eve goes on a date. Stacey receives another letter from her stalker and Vinny tries to convince Suki to relax. Freddie tries to play matchmaker between Anna and Bobby

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vintage bike restorer Tim Gunn meets 80-year-old Peter Swash who brings in an ancient penny-farthing for him to repair. Having already been patched up 65-years previously when he first got the bike, Peter is hoping an expert can bring it back to life. Betty brings in a battered leather briefcase given to her as a gift for passing her engineering qualification. After spending 65 years using the briefcase while working as the first ever female member of the Institute for Structural Engineers, Betty is hoping master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher can restore the case to its former glory. Steve Fletcher uses his expertise to repair an old clocking-on machine from the British Rail depot in Crewe but the job takes an unexpected turn when he discovers a mystery cog with no obvious place in the mechanism

programme.title: Kiri's TV Flashback
programme.desc: Comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean looks for more amusing clips in the BBC Wales TV archive to discover how hobbies, pastimes and all of the ways the Welsh have fun have been documented

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd Farm who bought the property despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley presents a compilation of stories from the archives from Isle Martin in Scotland, where he meets the only resident and helps prepare for a seaweed festival. Featuring Anita Rani meeting female farmers in the Inner Hebrides, Ellie Harrison taking a trip to Church Island in Northern Ireland, and Margherita Taylor surveying seals off Looe Island. Plus, a chance to catch up with Mari Huws on Bardsey Island, just off north Wales's Llyn Peninsula

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the US Army's First Armoured Division, travelling into the desert to take part in a field exercise testing the combat readiness of troops and weaponry

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The causes behind a fatal road traffic collision are investigated, as it becomes apparent that someone may have fallen asleep at the wheel. Plus, Trading Standards officers get justice for a vicar who was tricked into paying tens of thousands of pounds to a cowboy builder

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits the Medway area of Kent in Upnor to see a two-bed terrace with bags of character in a conservation area. Martin Roberts is in Bristol to look around a three-bed semi-detached 1930s build. Dion Dublin heads to Birmingham, where a bathroom from a bygone era catches his eye. They then revisit all three properties once they have been traded at auction and renovated in line with their new owners' wishes

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Ardingly antiques fair, and finds out about a distinctive style of wood carving. Experts Philip Serrell and Roo Irvine assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble shares 'prey-eye view' footage featuring a pride of lions. Hamza Yassin attempts to befriend a kangaroo, known as Brave, who is notoriously nervous around men

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The culinary expert is in Falmouth, where he enjoys dishes prepared by an innovative chef called Andy Tuck. Rick also meets Judy, the daughter of acclaimed author William Golding

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah heads to Woodbridge in Suffolk to help her buyers channel their get-up-and-go instinct and move away from their quiet hamlet life outside the city of Chester. They have up to £500,000 to spend on a Suffolk town house that can deliver style and kerb appeal. Sailing on the River Deben, exploring Woodbridge's colourful historic streets and visiting its first-rate cinema paint the perfect picture of an attractive town with star quality

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Hobbyist weaver has so far struggled to break into the textile market and mentor Piyush thinks he knows why. Jessica loves colour, but doesn't have a plan of how many she uses in her pieces. Piyush sets her a challenge of using no more than four colours in each of four seasonal collections. Nyanda is a passionate and talented jeweller with a strong design eye, but her business has stalled. Mentor Rachel wants her to make simpler pieces she can produce more quickly and sell for more affordable prices. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a silver saxophone, a stained-glass window panel depicting the Blackpool Tower and a music box shaped like a grand piano. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the annual Neath Food and Drink Festival and finds out whether traditional or gourmet Welsh cakes are more popular among the visitors. Cookery writer Michaela Chiappa discovers how seaweed is being harvested for food in Pembrokeshire, Onkar Singh Purewal reveals the secrets of beekeeping, and farmer Meinir Howells finds out how dairy farmers are selling milk direct, while avoiding the supermarkets

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey prepares for a visit from the social workers and advises Eve against seeing Caroline. Alfie struggles to process his recent news when Tommy reveals he saw him heading to the hospital. Bernie's party is a raging success but Bobby worries Anna has feelings for Freddie

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining contenders face three more culinary challenges as they battle for their place in the quarter final. First, The Pairs Challenge sees the celebrities split into two pairs to cook a dish, with only one of the pair given the basic instruction on how to prepare it. Next, the contestants are sent to a professional kitchen during a busy lunchtime service, before facing their final test - the all-new Food Truck Challenge.

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: After becoming famous across the world, expectation levels are at an all-time high when the Welsh players return home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Dark Land: Hunting the Killers
programme.desc: The team reinvestigate the 1991 murder of 25-year-old Clive Tully, a backpacker from New Zealand whose body was found dismembered in bags dumped in roadside lay-bys all across Gwent. His killer was later found to be a man he had befriended, a convicted killer called Malcom Green

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is in the Cotswolds at the Broadway Tower folly to look back at unusual events that have featured on the programme over the years. Including the time Anita Rani met a farmer growing a crop of chairs, and when Margherita Taylor made microscopic art from nature

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dom helps track down fugitives with a bounty on their heads as he works as a private investigator in Waco, Texas. His mentor is James Fullner, a private investigator who's spent 15 years in the business, exposing cheating partners and business fraud, and apprehending fugitives on the run. Working alongside an armed team of investigators, on behalf of a local bail bondsman, they hit the streets in pursuit of a violent fugitive, a runaway drug addict and a wanted sex offender

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The causes of a £1.5million collision involving a party boat on the River Thames are examined. Plus, investigators put a stop to a medical scam that could put lives at risk and crack down on bogus immigration advisors

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a two-bedroom semi-detached in Stafford in the West Midlands bought by a couple of renovation rookies and a mixed commercial and residential lot in Worthing, West Sussex. Martel Maxwel meets a pair of London developers who have bought a mid-terrace in the Yorkshire city of Doncaster

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, with the reds and the blue teams being guided by experts John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. While the competition heats up, Natasha tries her hand at puppeteering

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble provide an update on giant rodent, Bart the capybara, as he is introduced to a new mate. Plus, Kate heads to Koala Creek to be introduced to a bettong and a long-nosed potoroo, two species that have been badly affected by the Australian wild fires but now play a vital role in the recovery of those forests

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets a professional forager who takes him on a tour around the beautiful Camel Estuary. Inspired, the chef creates his version of a Greek Horta pie with foraged greens

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah makes a beeline for the desirable town of Sevenoaks in Kent, to help buyers who are selling up their London flat and sinking their £900,000 budget into a new life

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Recently diagnosed with autism and dyslexia Shannon has only ever given the hand turned bowls she makes on her incredible foot-powered pole lathe as presents. Dom Chinea and mentor Alice love her work and the way she produces it and want to convince Shannon that she and the bowls she creates are much more marketable than she thinks. Successful musician Ryan wants to quit touring to spend more time at home with his young family and hopes an upcycling business will make that possible. Mentor Zoe can see his work is high quality, but is worried his style doesn't stand out from the crowd

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Visitor Mike presents the engagement and wedding rings he designed for his late wife Sarah. His daughter is now nearing her 21st birthday, and Mike would love her to have her mother's rings as a birthday gift. Goldsmith Richard Talman excels himself to get these broken, bent and faded pieces back to their sparkling best. An old-fashioned penny slot machine and a wooden writing box are also restored

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher finds tips and treats among the food producers in Cardiff Market, from making Indian street food to baking vegan cakes that taste the same as conventional ones. Also, farmer Meinir Howells goes underground to reveal the secrets of cheese production in Harlech, and investigates the growing popularity of keeping chickens. Onkar Singh Purewal discovers the surprising array of food being produced in city centre community gardens

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: After suffering some traumatic events in his life, ex-Royal Air Force aircraft engineer Simon Parker needed a change, so left the mainland to begin a new life as the warden of Flatholm Island. Four miles from Cardiff, in the middle of the Bristol Channel, Flatholm has no mains power or water and is exposed to the worst of the weather. It is a site of special scientific interest because of its gull colony, which makes up 20 per cent of the Welsh gull population and is a crucial breeding ground. As this programme reveals, the more Simon learns about the remote location, the more he learns about himself

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: In the quarter-final, the remaining celebrities cook a two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also previous Celebrity MasterChef finalists Andi Peters, Rylan and Vicky Pattison. The contestants need to pull out all the stops as they try to to secure their place in the semi-finals

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Martin gets into even deeper water with the Slater brothers, while accountant Alan has surprising information for Kath and Diane, providing them with the perfect opportunity to get revenge on the philandering businessman. The first step is for Kath to steal an important document from the office - but when Martin turns up, things don't go exactly as planned

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rewind: 60 Years of Welsh Pop
programme.desc: A decade-by-decade look at Welsh pop artists of the past. This episode focuses on the 1970s, with early TV appearances by Badfinger, Man, Dave Edmunds, Bonnie Tyler and Young Marble Giants. Plus, classic TV performances by Tom Jones and Shirley Bassey

programme.title: Heat (1995)
programme.desc: An armoured car hold-up sets a veteran police detective on the trail of a highly intelligent career criminal, whom he is obsessed with capturing. Meanwhile, the robber is planning an elaborate bank heist as his final job before retiring, and a complex game of cat and mouse develops between the two. Michael Mann's crime thriller, starring Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight, Tom Sizemore and Natalie Portman

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley presents a compilation of stories from the archives from Isle Martin in Scotland, where he meets the only resident and helps prepare for a seaweed festival. Featuring Anita Rani meeting female farmers in the Inner Hebrides, Ellie Harrison taking a trip to Church Island in Northern Ireland, and Margherita Taylor surveying seals off Looe Island. Plus, a chance to catch up with Mari Huws on Bardsey Island, just off north Wales's Llyn Peninsula

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood joins the US Army's First Armoured Division, travelling into the desert to take part in a field exercise testing the combat readiness of troops and weaponry

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The causes behind a fatal road traffic collision are investigated, as it becomes apparent that someone may have fallen asleep at the wheel. Plus, Trading Standards officers get justice for a vicar who was tricked into paying tens of thousands of pounds to a cowboy builder

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits the Medway area of Kent in Upnor to see a two-bed terrace with bags of character in a conservation area. Martin Roberts is in Bristol to look around a three-bed semi-detached 1930s build. Dion Dublin heads to Birmingham, where a bathroom from a bygone era catches his eye. They then revisit all three properties once they have been traded at auction and renovated in line with their new owners' wishes

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Ardingly antiques fair, and finds out about a distinctive style of wood carving. Experts Philip Serrell and Roo Irvine assist the teams

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Kate Humble shares 'prey-eye view' footage featuring a pride of lions. Hamza Yassin attempts to befriend a kangaroo, known as Brave, who is notoriously nervous around men

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The culinary expert is in Falmouth, where he enjoys dishes prepared by an innovative chef called Andy Tuck. Rick also meets Judy, the daughter of acclaimed author William Golding

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah heads to Woodbridge in Suffolk to help her buyers channel their get-up-and-go instinct and move away from their quiet hamlet life outside the city of Chester. They have up to £500,000 to spend on a Suffolk town house that can deliver style and kerb appeal. Sailing on the River Deben, exploring Woodbridge's colourful historic streets and visiting its first-rate cinema paint the perfect picture of an attractive town with star quality

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Hobbyist weaver has so far struggled to break into the textile market and mentor Piyush thinks he knows why. Jessica loves colour, but doesn't have a plan of how many she uses in her pieces. Piyush sets her a challenge of using no more than four colours in each of four seasonal collections. Nyanda is a passionate and talented jeweller with a strong design eye, but her business has stalled. Mentor Rachel wants her to make simpler pieces she can produce more quickly and sell for more affordable prices. Presented by Dominic Chinea

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a silver saxophone, a stained-glass window panel depicting the Blackpool Tower and a music box shaped like a grand piano. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon dons a helmet and hits the streets to discover why eScooters are leaving some pedestrians feeling scared. Plus, the small businesses ruined by crooks who hijacked their online listings to steal customers. Co-presented by Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey prepares for a visit from the social workers and advises Eve against seeing Caroline. Alfie struggles to process his recent news when Tommy reveals he saw him heading to the hospital. Bernie's party is a raging success but Bobby worries Anna has feelings for Freddie

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The four remaining contenders face three more culinary challenges as they battle for their place in the quarter final. First, The Pairs Challenge sees the celebrities split into two pairs to cook a dish, with only one of the pair given the basic instruction on how to prepare it. Next, the contestants are sent to a professional kitchen during a busy lunchtime service, before facing their final test - the all-new Food Truck Challenge.

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: The genealogy documentary follows eight more celebrities as they trace their family trees to uncover facts about their heritage. First up is Our Girl actress Michelle Keegan, who discovers the dark story of how her great-grandmother Leonor, who lived on Gibraltar, was evacuated during the Second World War. She then goes further back to her great-great-grandmother, who lived in poverty in Manchester at the start of the 20th century. But as Michelle investigates, she unearths a special connection to the suffragette movement

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Extraordinary Portraits
programme.desc: Adebanji Alade, President of the Royal Institute of Oil Painters, takes up the challenge of depicting three generations of a family who have all worked in the NHS. Grandmother Bea came to the UK as part of the Windrush generation and was employed as a health worker. Her daughter Gerrie has been a matron for 36 years, her husband Calvin retrained as a mental health nurse at the age of 49, and their three daughters all work for the NHS in Nottinghamshire, as a senior assistant in recruitment, a paediatric critical care nurse, and a student nurse

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison is in the Cotswolds at the Broadway Tower folly to look back at unusual events that have featured on the programme over the years. Including the time Anita Rani met a farmer growing a crop of chairs, and when Margherita Taylor made microscopic art from nature

programme.title: Dom Does America
programme.desc: Dom helps track down fugitives with a bounty on their heads as he works as a private investigator in Waco, Texas. His mentor is James Fullner, a private investigator who's spent 15 years in the business, exposing cheating partners and business fraud, and apprehending fugitives on the run. Working alongside an armed team of investigators, on behalf of a local bail bondsman, they hit the streets in pursuit of a violent fugitive, a runaway drug addict and a wanted sex offender

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The causes of a £1.5million collision involving a party boat on the River Thames are examined. Plus, investigators put a stop to a medical scam that could put lives at risk and crack down on bogus immigration advisors

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a two-bedroom semi-detached in Stafford in the West Midlands bought by a couple of renovation rookies and a mixed commercial and residential lot in Worthing, West Sussex. Martel Maxwel meets a pair of London developers who have bought a mid-terrace in the Yorkshire city of Doncaster

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp presents from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, with the reds and the blue teams being guided by experts John Cameron and Stephanie Connell. While the competition heats up, Natasha tries her hand at puppeteering

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Kate Humble provide an update on giant rodent, Bart the capybara, as he is introduced to a new mate. Plus, Kate heads to Koala Creek to be introduced to a bettong and a long-nosed potoroo, two species that have been badly affected by the Australian wild fires but now play a vital role in the recovery of those forests

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets a professional forager who takes him on a tour around the beautiful Camel Estuary. Inspired, the chef creates his version of a Greek Horta pie with foraged greens

programme.title: Escape to the Perfect Town
programme.desc: Sonali Shah makes a beeline for the desirable town of Sevenoaks in Kent, to help buyers who are selling up their London flat and sinking their £900,000 budget into a new life

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Recently diagnosed with autism and dyslexia Shannon has only ever given the hand turned bowls she makes on her incredible foot-powered pole lathe as presents. Dom Chinea and mentor Alice love her work and the way she produces it and want to convince Shannon that she and the bowls she creates are much more marketable than she thinks. Successful musician Ryan wants to quit touring to spend more time at home with his young family and hopes an upcycling business will make that possible. Mentor Zoe can see his work is high quality, but is worried his style doesn't stand out from the crowd

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Visitor Mike presents the engagement and wedding rings he designed for his late wife Sarah. His daughter is now nearing her 21st birthday, and Mike would love her to have her mother's rings as a birthday gift. Goldsmith Richard Talman excels himself to get these broken, bent and faded pieces back to their sparkling best. An old-fashioned penny slot machine and a wooden writing box are also restored

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville find out why some 'no win no fee' legal cases might have an expensive sting in the tail

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: After suffering some traumatic events in his life, ex-Royal Air Force aircraft engineer Simon Parker needed a change, so left the mainland to begin a new life as the warden of Flatholm Island. Four miles from Cardiff, in the middle of the Bristol Channel, Flatholm has no mains power or water and is exposed to the worst of the weather. It is a site of special scientific interest because of its gull colony, which makes up 20 per cent of the Welsh gull population and is a crucial breeding ground. As this programme reveals, the more Simon learns about the remote location, the more he learns about himself

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: In the quarter-final, the remaining celebrities cook a two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also previous Celebrity MasterChef finalists Andi Peters, Rylan and Vicky Pattison. The contestants need to pull out all the stops as they try to to secure their place in the semi-finals

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Martin gets into even deeper water with the Slater brothers, while accountant Alan has surprising information for Kath and Diane, providing them with the perfect opportunity to get revenge on the philandering businessman. The first step is for Kath to steal an important document from the office - but when Martin turns up, things don't go exactly as planned

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Two Doors Down
programme.desc: Beth and Eric think Ian is taking them out for a 30th wedding anniversary dinner, but he and Gordon are actually throwing them a surprise party at their house. Ian tries to keep the focus on his mum and dad, but a drunk Cathy treats Eric, Beth and the rest of the guests to a replay of her and Colin's first wedding dance. Comedy, starring Arabella Weir, Alex Norton, Doon Mackichan, Jonathan Watson and Elaine C Smith

programme.title: Heat (1995)
programme.desc: An armoured car hold-up sets a veteran police detective on the trail of a highly intelligent career criminal, whom he is obsessed with capturing. Meanwhile, the robber is planning an elaborate bank heist as his final job before retiring, and a complex game of cat and mouse develops between the two. Michael Mann's crime thriller, starring Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight, Tom Sizemore and Natalie Portman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison explores the powers of the great outdoors to provide a tonic in troubled times as she immerses herself in nature, from forest bathing to wild swimming. There are also films from the Countryfile archives about the health-giving prowess of the UK's green havens, including John Craven finding out how nature helped heal wartime wounds, and Anita Rani visiting a special farm giving respite to refugees

programme.title: MOTD Live: FIFA Women's World Cup
programme.desc: Australia v England (Kick-off 11.00am). Coverage of the second semi-final, which comes from Stadium Australia in Sydney. The co-hosts edged out France on penalties in the quarter-finals, while England came back from behind to prevail 2-1 against Colombia

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Animal Park
programme.desc: The team celebrate the wild stretch of water that is 'half mile lake' which is home to Californian sealions, African hippos and native beavers with gorillas and monkeys living on the banks. Hamza Yassin is given special access to the park after the visitors have gone home so he can capture some of the wildlife living in the lake. Kate Humble joins the vets as they check up on Wilma the cheetah who has kidney disease. Megan McCubbin visits Chico the sloth to ensure the conditions in his enclosure match the ones he would be used to in the wild

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a couple looking for a home in North Yorkshire on a budget of £300,000, and also joins a hedgerow harvest to fill a basket with berries used for sloe gin

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Dom Chinea helps artist Jack and potter Jeanet make their passions into money-making businesses. Jack is hoping to swap teaching for creating before it's too late, Dom and mentor Sharon are impressed with his multimedia artwork but are worried that he only seems to use his family as his subjects. University lecturer Jeanet struggles to find time to turn her hobby into a profession but mentor Florian thinks speed and finishing touches are what she needs to make a profit

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Stephney and Charlotte bring Charlotte's old trike, hoping restorer Tim Gunn can bring it back to life. Charlotte has wonderful childhood memories whizzing around on this trusty, yet rusty chariot, which was gifted to her by a kindly neighbour. She now has two young children of her own and would love them to enjoy it as much as she did. A silver and turquoise bracelet and a cherished pair of red ballet shoes are also restored. Presented by Jay Blades

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Gyles Brandreth

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Angela Rippon and Gloria Hunniford take a look at the parcel delivery company that's had a rebrand but which viewers say is still not up to scratch. Plus, the families who say they've been let down by the developers who've left playgrounds unfinished and unusable

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda debates fighting for custody of Janine and Mick's baby and Eve goes on a date. Stacey receives another letter from her stalker and Vinny tries to convince Suki to relax. Freddie tries to play matchmaker between Anna and Bobby

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Vintage bike restorer Tim Gunn meets 80-year-old Peter Swash who brings in an ancient penny-farthing for him to repair. Having already been patched up 65-years previously when he first got the bike, Peter is hoping an expert can bring it back to life. Betty brings in a battered leather briefcase given to her as a gift for passing her engineering qualification. After spending 65 years using the briefcase while working as the first ever female member of the Institute for Structural Engineers, Betty is hoping master saddlemaker Suzie Fletcher can restore the case to its former glory. Steve Fletcher uses his expertise to repair an old clocking-on machine from the British Rail depot in Crewe but the job takes an unexpected turn when he discovers a mystery cog with no obvious place in the mechanism

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and Will Kirk travel to Northumbria to help retired school teachers Mike and Carole declutter their home and raise money for a trip abroad to visit their grandchild. Will quickly gets to work on some furniture in desperate need of a revamp and Christina uncovers several potentially profitable items to take to auction

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Drag artist Cheryl Hole, actor and singer Jamelia, musician Locksmith, former glamour model Sam Fox and opera singer Wynne Evans compete in the penultimate week of heats. Facing the Under the Cloche challenge, the celebrities are each given a different ingredient they must incorporate into a dish to demonstrate their potential to judges Greg Wallace and John Torode. In a final attempt to impress, the contestants prepare their Dinner Party Dishes with hopes of not being the one person going home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Radio presenter Sian Eleri investigates the paranormal activity at Penyffordd Farm in north Wales, the house being widely considered the most haunted house in Britain in the late 1990s. She begins by meeting with specialist psychologist Dr Daniels who was called in by the family living on the farm at the time when they became desperate for answers for the strange activity in their home. The doctor explains that of the many apparently paranormal cases of his career, this was the one that stayed with him and still perplexes him to this day

programme.title: Paranormal: The Girl, The Ghost and The Gravestone
programme.desc: Sian Eleri meets the current owner of Penyffordd Farm who bought the property despite the stories of its haunting. Dr Daniels suggests that moving the gravestone on the property is what started the paranormal activity, leading Sian to investigate if there really is a girl buried in the garden

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: The Paddy Raff Show
programme.desc: More sketches featuring the popular stand-up comedian, showcasing his unique and quirky take on modern life. In this episode, DJ Morgan-K gets fired from Bel-FM, Granny Raff babysits the grandchildren, while Father Pat rocks the mainstage at Belfast's Penance Vital Festival

programme.desc: Paralympic legend Hannah Cockroft, former Premier League striker Clinton Morrison, Great Britain sprinter Desiree Henry and sports broadcaster Nat Coombs join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Material from the comedy panel show, not originally shown in the series 16 episodes. Hosted by Rob Brydon, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack joined by celebrity guests including Motsi Mabuse, Bez, Sarah Greene, Joe Wilkinson, Snoochie Shy, Lucy Martin, Anton Du Beke, Jo Brand, Steve Pemberton, Shazia Mirza, Lucy Beaumont, Tom Allen, Amol Rajan, Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and Morgana Robinson

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: In the quarter-final, the remaining celebrities cook a two-course meal that will not only be judged by John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also previous Celebrity MasterChef finalists Andi Peters, Rylan and Vicky Pattison. The contestants need to pull out all the stops as they try to to secure their place in the semi-finals

programme.title: The Power of Parker
programme.desc: Martin gets into even deeper water with the Slater brothers, while accountant Alan has surprising information for Kath and Diane, providing them with the perfect opportunity to get revenge on the philandering businessman. The first step is for Kath to steal an important document from the office - but when Martin turns up, things don't go exactly as planned

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Two Doors Down
programme.desc: Beth and Eric think Ian is taking them out for a 30th wedding anniversary dinner, but he and Gordon are actually throwing them a surprise party at their house. Ian tries to keep the focus on his mum and dad, but a drunk Cathy treats Eric, Beth and the rest of the guests to a replay of her and Colin's first wedding dance. Comedy, starring Arabella Weir, Alex Norton, Doon Mackichan, Jonathan Watson and Elaine C Smith

programme.title: Heat (1995)
programme.desc: An armoured car hold-up sets a veteran police detective on the trail of a highly intelligent career criminal, whom he is obsessed with capturing. Meanwhile, the robber is planning an elaborate bank heist as his final job before retiring, and a complex game of cat and mouse develops between the two. Michael Mann's crime thriller, starring Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight, Tom Sizemore and Natalie Portman

programme.title: Windrush: Portraits of a Generation
programme.desc: Marking the 75th anniversary of the arrival of the HMT Empire Windrush to British shores in 1948, cameras follow a project spearheaded by King Charles. He commissioned 10 leading artists, from Britain and abroad, to create portraits of 10 pioneering members of the Windrush Generation. The sitters, many in their nineties, speak frankly about their experiences of arriving in Britain, making lives for themselves, and the contribution they have made to their communities and the nation

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Once dubbed the 'murder capital' of the world, for nearly three decades, rival gangs ruled the streets of El Salvador through a regime of violence, extortion and fear. That is, until now. For the last year, the country's young, media-savvy president has launched a full-scale war on gangs, imposing emergency constitutional measures and giving police sweeping new powers of arrest. As the State of Exception passes its one-year anniversary, more than 65,000 people have been arrested and dramatic images of a new 'mega prison' hit headlines around the world. But as the country transforms before people's eyes, this newfound freedom hides a dark reality. The government is accused of locking up thousands of innocent people without trial and in flagrant abuse of their human rights. Will Grant meets families impacted by both sides of this controversial policy to uncover the hidden cost of peace on the streets.

programme.title: The Travel Show
programme.desc: It's the finale of The Travel Show special 'How Does a Blind Girl Go on Safari?'. Visually impaired Lucy Edwards makes her way to the Maasai Mara for 'The Great Migration', said to be one of nature's most spectacular events. In this episode, Lucy comes across the last line of defence against rhino poaching, hikes down to the foot of Thomson's Falls, and spends the day at a Maasai Village. But will she get the chance to experience one of the elusive river crossings where wildebeest risk their lives passing lions and crocodiles? Part 2 of 2.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, James and local boy Paul Rankin brave the Carrick-a-Rede rope bridge together, then James cooks a tasty fish dish with the dramatic coastline as his backdrop. There's a fishing trip over to Rathlin Island on the menu too, where James tastes some dishes made from the local kelp. The duo then visit the Old Lammas Fair, where they taste some of the delicious seafood, before James cooks up a delicious boozy sweet treat using some of Ireland's tastiest liquor

programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Paul, Beth, Mark and Emma pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: Kate Garraway's Life Stories
programme.desc: This time, the presenter is joined in conversation by the Iranian-British actor, comedian and writer Omid Djalili. Omid reveals how this erratic home life led to a slightly chequered school career which saw him take his A levels a record six times, forge his A level results, and get turned down from 16 drama schools. Against all the odds, Omid's acting career flourished and his credits range from Hollywood films to the West End stage, and he tells Kate why he made the important decision to continue writing jokes about race and religion, even when his own personal safety was under threat

programme.title: The Ipcress File

Dalby's rekindled love for the doctor takes its toll on his judgement at work and his composure at home where he can no longer bear to live in a joyless marriage. General Cathcart is dismayed by the cancellation of the neutron bomb project and invites Maddox to join a plan that will correct these errors of national direction.

programme.title: The Ipcress File
programme.desc: When Maddox hires Polish fixer Housemartin to find and hold Harry, Jean uses her wits and a wiretap to find out where he is, while Dalby warns the Minister that the American government is threatened by an imminent coup d'état. Harry is tormented by fears of what has been planted in his mind, but is lured to the country house where prime minister Harold Macmillan is to meet US president John F Kennedy

programme.desc: This time, the presenter is joined in conversation by the Iranian-British actor, comedian and writer Omid Djalili. Omid reveals how this erratic home life led to a slightly chequered school career which saw him take his A levels a record six times, forge his A level results, and get turned down from 16 drama schools. Against all the odds, Omid's acting career flourished and his credits range from Hollywood films to the West End stage, and he tells Kate why he made the important decision to continue writing jokes about race and religion, even when his own personal safety was under threat

Guest starring Glynis Barber, with Bradley Walsh and Paul Nicholls

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: It is the annual Portwenn versus Port Carran gig race and school gig festival, and this time Penhale is the umpire and Morwenna is the Portwenn team captain. Meanwhile, Mel Hendy goes to see Martin at the surgery worried about a rash that could be infectious, but she ends up opening up to him about her concerns over her husband's drinking. Elsewhere, Martin and Louisa arrive home to find Chris Parsons waiting for them

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Return of the detective drama starring Bradley Walsh. Ronnie and new partner Joe lead the investigation into the death of jeweller Harry Bernstein, who has been found with his hands and teeth missing. His wife, her lover and a former business associate are all possible suspects, but the case takes a surprising turn when the victim's sister receives a gruesome delivery. She's on the jury for the trial of a drug dealer and murderer who Ronnie has been trying to nail for years, and the threat to her points to jury tampering, so Jake and Kate have to take a dramatic approach to win the case. The problem is, they're up against a formidable defence barrister. Co-starring Ben Bailey Smith, Dominic Rowan and Georgia Taylor, with guests Helen Baxendale and Christopher Fulford

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: James, Tim and Chris are exposed as having lied about their whereabouts on the night Hayley died. programme.title: Unforgotten

programme.title: The Sweeney
programme.desc: The son of an ex-informant is kidnapped and the Flying Squad is brought in to assist in the hunt. Against Regan's advice his father, a wealthy businessman, pays the ransom and the boy is returned. However, the reunion quickly turns sour. Joss Ackland guest stars, with John Thaw

programme.title: The Champions

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Much and Scarlet have a frightening encounter with a group of lepers, while Robin rescues a noblewoman from bandits - and learns he is related to his deadly enemy Guy of Gisburne. Dorothy Tutin guest stars

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Thomas guards a wealthy socialite's quarantined dog from former owner Victor DiGiorgio, a gangster determined to retrieve it by any means necessary. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: Extreme Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Luke and his team are called to a farm in Donnybrook, Western Australia, where a 20-tonne excavator known as The Mud Monster is bogged. The owner was trying to build a recreational dam when the machine got stuck and it has been out of action for months now, burning money and holding up construction. Two other companies have failed to remove it and Team Salvage has just 24 hours and a 5,000 dollar budget to get it done

programme.desc: Day four in Basingstoke finds winery worker Izzy planning a sophisticated evening, though whether her fancy approach will prove too much of a risk remains to be seen. DJ and nutritionist Mark irritates Izzy by not sticking to her dress code, while Adam and Chris embrace the black-tie event. Will the self-confessed queen of dinner parties give the guests a night to remember and put herself in the top spot, or will the sophistication be too much for some?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final host from in and around the Hampshire town of Basingstoke is snappy dresser Chris, who hopes to impress his guests with a '90s music dress code and a menu of French dishes made with local produce. Chris has been disappointed with the standard of cooking all week and plans to take it up a notch for the final night, but there's simmering tensions between Mark and well-spoken Izzy

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the long-running words-and-numbers game with singer, actor and lyricist Tom Read Wilson joining Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In France, cameras catch up with the owners of a motorhome rental business about to hit the fast lane. In Spain, there is a return to a cycling retreat business, whose owners have been forced to rethink their business model thanks to the impact of Covid

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On Payment Day, Carl is keen to quiz Simon and Joe over their breakfast woes, while Rick and Sarah want to know why they were scored so badly for their hosting skills. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final night in Nottingham sees sales manager Jon throw an Italian-themed evening in a bid to win the £1,000 prize. His guests are impressed when Jon reveals that he has made the wine he's serving, but Cherie and Tamika struggle to guess the key ingredients. With the party in full flow, Janelle reveals not one but two surprises including a royal connection and her very own 'superpower'

programme.title: The Simpsons

In the West Country, Rachel and Ronnie help Caroline, who inherited an inn from her father but has made the difficult decision to part with some of its weird and wonderful contents in order to invest on the building. programme.title: The 1970s Supermarket
programme.desc: The story of the shopping revolution, as Britain went from small behind-the-counter shops to massive megastores, with trolleys, booze sections and barcodes. The first episode reveals how the nation went crazy for convenience food, which back then came in cans, such as wartime favourite Spam. Chris Clarke also whisks up the fluffy dessert Angel Delight, and the programme explores how the rise of the home freezer heralded the birth of frozen food chains Iceland and Bejam
