programme.title: My Cornwall with Fern Britton
programme.desc: The last leg of the presenter's road trip takes her to an industrious corner of Cornwall, the ancient Hundreds of Kerrier and Penwith. Fern discovers one of the best preserved ancient farming villages in the South West, which are among the oldest structures on the planet. Later, she visits the Lizard Peninsula, an area of outstanding natural beauty that as well as its unique landscape boasts a number of gems, including Cornish sea salt, Hevva Cake and Huer Huts. Finally, she meets some of the team from the RNLI at Lizard Point, the southernmost tip of mainland Britain

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Susan Calman's Grand Week by the Sea
programme.desc: In Southwold on the Suffolk coast, Susan starts by viewing the charming seaside spot from the town's lighthouse - which isn't at all where you'd expect - before setting sail to explore Southwold from the sea. She also visits the picturesque village of Walberswick via one of the shortest and most fabulous ferry rides in the world, and Thorpeness, where she takes a rowing boat on a lake in the heart of the village. Susan also meets up with interior design guru Laurence Llewellyn-Bowen for a game of quoits on the beach and the pair also RSPB Minsmere nature reserve

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Human remains turn up at the Native American reservation, and Rainwater thinks Kayce is to blame. Meanwhile, Kayce and Monica try to shelter Tate from the exodus of his cousins following their mother's suicide. Rip sticks up for a ranch hand whom he recently welcomed into the Yellowstone fold, while John's staff learn that he has colon cancer

programme.title: Stock Aitken Waterman: Legends of Pop
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at the career of the songwriting and record production trio consisting of Mike Stock, Matt Aitken, and Pete Waterman, a story of incredible success but also of fractured relationships and court cases. The first edition examines the early days of SAW and the very varied cast list of acts who entered their world, from the outrageous American drag star Divine, who gave them their first Top 40 hit, through to Hazell Dean, who took them into the Top 10

programme.title: Stock Aitken Waterman: Greatest Hits
programme.desc: Inside the Hit Factory, home of music production team Stock, Aitken and Waterman, with smashes from Rick Astley, Kylie Minogue, Jason Donovan and many more

programme.title: PlayOJO Live Casino Show
programme.desc: Interactive gambling

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Fiona Phillips examines the changing fortunes of the supermarket chain, which has lost its position at the top of the business in recent years, squeezed between upmarket rivals and discount stores offering lower prices. The programme features contributions from employees, customers and financial experts, and examines the challenges in dominating the middle market and attempting to be competitive on both price and quality

programme.title: Get Your Tatts Out: Kavos Ink
programme.desc: Three lads hit a Greek tattoo studio after a heavy night's drinking, only for one of them to wake up the next day with a 'burger nipple'. Another holiday-maker loses a bet which means he has to get a picture of his friends etched on his backside, and a Manchester bloke waltzes out of a tattoo studio with a pair of lips inked onto his bum

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: Volunteers for the Wildlife Aid Rescue Centre come to the aid of a heron, a grass snake and newborn hedgehogs

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Estate agent Ann Maurice offers her expertise to a couple whose home in Rothwell near Leeds is still for sale after 10 months, despite having attracted more than 30 viewings. Her advice includes ridding the house of the all-pervading pet smell, replacing the threadbare stair carpet and adding a lick of paint in a bid to persuade the next viewer to make an offer

programme.title: Entertainment News on 5
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: While he is working on the Chinese Railway, Thomas tries to save an accident-prone truck named Lei who is racing down the tracks

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: Uncle Otis is hurtling down Jake's Mountain in a runaway mine car, so Ryder and the Pups need to rescue him before it crashes

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs (2009)
programme.desc: An orphaned brother and sister face losing their beloved dog when they go into a foster home that does not allow pets. The kids find the ideal hiding place in an abandoned hotel, and set about transforming it into luxury canine accommodation for not just their beloved pet, but every stray in town. Family comedy, starring Emma Roberts, Jake T Austin, Don Cheadle and Lisa Kudrow

programme.title: Patrick (2018)
programme.desc: A young woman's chaotic life becomes more complicated when she inherits her grandmother's dog. Comedy, starring Beattie Edmondson, Ed Skrein, Jennifer Saunders and Cherie Lunghi

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part 1 Interview Special
programme.desc: Tom Cruise, Hayley Atwell, Simon Pegg and director Christopher McQuarrie talk about the seventh film in the action-adventure series

programme.title: Jason and the Argonauts (1963)
programme.desc: The son of an overthrown king must embark on an epic sea voyage in search of the fabled Golden Fleece so he can return and reclaim his kingdom. Before he can seize the treasure, he has to overcome a series of horrific creatures, including a seven-headed monster and a horde of sword-wielding skeletons. Mythological fantasy adventure, starring Todd Armstrong, Honor Blackman, Nancy Kovack, Niall MacGinnis and Patrick Troughton, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: Men in Black (1997)
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: Men in Black II (2002)
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: The Godfather (1972)
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppola's gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

programme.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad! (1988)
programme.desc: While investigating the shooting of a colleague, disaster-prone police lieutenant Frank Drebin uncovers a plot to assassinate the Queen during her visit to Los Angeles. However, after he is sacked from the force by the mayor, the cop has to operate beneath the radar to get to the bottom of the conspiracy. Comedy, with Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley and Ricardo Montalban

programme.title: P'Tang Yang Kipperbang (1982)
programme.desc: A 14-year-old schoolboy Alan struggles to cope with growing up in the post-war period. He becomes infatuated with a classmate but is too shy to do anything about it. When he learns he will have to kiss her in the school play, he is terrified at the prospect. Director Michael Apted's comedy drama, starring John Albasiny, Alison Steadman, Abigail Cruttenden and Robert Urquhart

programme.title: Oliver! (1968)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical version of the stage play based on Charles Dickens' classic tale about a lonely workhouse orphan who ends up on the cold streets of London, where he falls under the wing of petty crook Fagin and his gang of young backstreet thieves. Featuring the iconic songs Food, Glorious Food, Consider Yourself, As Long as He Needs Me and You've Got to Pick a Pocket or Two. Starring Ron Moody, Mark Lester, Oliver Reed, Jack Wild, Harry Secombe, Shani Wallis and Leonard Rossiter

programme.title: Oppenheimer Interview Special
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy, Matt Damon, Emily Blunt and director Christopher Nolan talk about making the historical dramatic thriller about J. Robert Oppenheimer

programme.title: Sister Act (1992)
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993)
programme.desc: A cabaret singer who once hid out in a convent is reunited with the nuns she befriended, who now need her help. She poses as a member of the order once more and joins the staff of a Catholic school threatened with closure, where she aims to make a success of the resident choir. Comedy sequel, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Najimy, Lauryn Hill, Maggie Smith and James Coburn

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee, and starring Emma Thompson (who also wrote the screenplay), Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: The Godfather Part II (1974)
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michael's story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito, as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale, Michael V Gazzo and Lee Strasberg

programme.title: The Naked Gun 2 1/2: The Smell of Fear (1991)
programme.desc: Blundering cop Frank Drebin discovers a secret conspiracy to kidnap a renowned solar energy expert and replace him with an imposter. As he sets out to bring the perpetrators to justice, he is unexpectedly reunited with an old flame. Slapstick comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, George Kennedy, Richard Griffiths and OJ Simpson

programme.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: The Long Haul (2017)
programme.desc: Youngster Greg Heffley hatches a plot to re-route a family road trip towards a videogame convention. Comedy sequel, starring Jason Drucker, Alicia Silverstone and Tom Everett Scott

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007)
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Jess befriends a new girl at school, and the pair begin to create their own imaginary kingdom in a secret place in the woods to escape the difficulties of their real lives. Unfortunately, a tragedy threatens to bring their fantasy world to an end. Drama based on Katherine Paterson's novel, starring Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel and Robert Patrick

programme.title: Bend It Like Beckham (2002)
programme.desc: An English schoolgirl tries to hide her passion for football from her strict Indian parents, knowing they disapprove of her tomboyish love of the game. However, when a semi-professional player sees her in action, she is offered a place on a team, forcing her to come up with a complex plan to keep her sporting career under wraps. Comedy, with Parminder Nagra, Keira Knightley, Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Juliet Stevenson and Shaznay Lewis

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee (1986)
programme.desc: A New York reporter searches the Australian Outback for a maverick hunter with a legendary reputation, and invites the adventurer back to America. But the die-hard Aussie needs to draw on all his survival skills to adjust to life in the urban jungle. Comedy adventure, written by and starring Paul Hogan, with Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Mark Blum

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: The Godfather Coda: The Death of Michael Corleone (2020)
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his family's Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Francis Ford Coppola's 2020 director's cut of The Godfather: Part III, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach and Bridget Fonda

programme.title: The Naked Gun 33 1/3: The Final Insult (1994)
programme.desc: Inept police detective Frank Drebin plans to retire from the force, but is lured back by the opportunity to foil a terrorist plot. Going undercover in prison, he sets out to prevent an evil mastermind from escaping and carrying out his fiendish plan - to bomb the Oscar awards ceremony. Comedy sequel, starring Leslie Nielsen, Priscilla Presley, OJ Simpson, George Kennedy and Fred Ward

programme.title: Airplane! (1980)
programme.desc: The passengers on board an ill-fated airliner become increasingly jittery when the flight crew flounder during a food-poisoning crisis. As ground control personnel struggle heroically to ensure the plane lands safely, a traumatised war veteran must face his fear to take the controls. Spoof disaster movie, starring Robert Hays, Leslie Nielsen, Robert Stack and Lloyd Bridges

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul leaves James with a threat he can't ignore as their feud gets worse. Dilly opens up to Ethan about her past before stumbling across something that could destroy his and Sienna's scheme. Love is in the air for Jack

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: An opportunity for Dilly to find out more about her rival presents itself. Tony's friendship with Rafe encourages him to make a change

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Rosaria bought Bella Luna to realise her son Gianfranco's ambition to become a chef, but the Italian restaurant's future looks bleak due to his lack of experience in the kitchen combined with her refusal to acknowledge the eatery's many flaws. Gordon Ramsay heads to Easton, Pennsylvania, to help the troubled pair and save the business from financial disaster

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The prodigy gets his first spot and is very worried about going through puberty and his childhood ending. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy prequel to The Big Bang Theory about nine-year-old Sheldon Cooper. He possesses a once-in-a-generation mind capable of advanced mathematics and science, but finds that gift isn't always helpful growing up in East Texas, a land where church and football are king. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad has time to kill when the arrival of the Serbian president's motorcade to Brooklyn is delayed, so Peralta launches the seventh annual Jimmy Jab Games, an eccentric series of races and contests held in the precinct building. Meanwhile, Jeffords and Holt must set up a new drug task force approved by Holt's nemesis, Madeline Wuntch

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: It's Halloween again, and this time Peralta bets Holt he can steal his treasured watch before midnight, enlisting criminal assistance to achieve his goal. Gina struggles to keep up with her college course, perform a full-time job and attend dance rehearsals - leading to problems both in and out of work

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Gloria panics when Joe is deemed too aggressive for gym class, leading her to worry that he has inherited a family curse, and Cam spins Lily a little white lie about her missing cat, only for it to spiral out of control. Phil taps into a rich new vein of clients - recently divorced women - but are they more trouble than they're worth? American comedy, starring Sofia Vergara, Eric Stonestreet and Ty Burrell

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam's older sister is in town but he is scared to share his engagement news with her because she is a sad, lonely singleton. Or so he thinks. Phil and Claire feel guilty when they make a joint decision to skip Luke's volleyball game and Jay tells Gloria she needs reading glasses - but she's not having any of it. The 100th episode of the family sitcom, starring Eric Stonetreet, Ty Burrell, Julie Bowen and Ed O'Neill

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The gang become concerned when Sheldon's former admirer Dr Ramona Nowitzki resurfaces while Amy is away working at Princeton University. Jim Parsons stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy must decide whether or not to marry Sheldon and gives him an answer to his proposal. Howard and Bernadette struggle with some unexpected news. With guest stars Laurie Metcalf, Riki Lindhome and Stephen Hawking

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriend's career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuart's help in replacing one of Howard's comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: After months of crashing with Malcolm and Marty, Calvin and Tina finally reveal the impressive results of their major home renovation

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin discovers Lorenzo is harbouring a secret and struggles with whether to tell Tina, while Dave becomes concerned about Gemma's growing closeness to a coach at her school

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Jay is troubled when best pal Shorty reveals that he and his wife are moving away. Phil and Claire take Haley out to discuss her future, while Mitchell and Cam take a break from all the wedding planning to enjoy a romantic meal - only to interrupt a couple's surprise engagement dinner. Chazz Palminteri and Jennifer Tilly guest star

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Claire thinks Luke is up to no good with his friends, so she persuades a reluctant Phil into helping her spy on their son. Gloria is suspicious of Jay when he starts moaning amorously in his sleep and Mitch struggles to keep a secret from Cam

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta faces paying back all the money he has borrowed from his colleagues over the years, and goes to great lengths to keep a secret about Sergeant Jeffords. Santiago and Captain Holt team up to reopen the Brooklyn Broiler arson case

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Sophia's job gets in the way of her relationship with Peralta, he tries to win the favour of her boss Geoffrey (guest star Chris Parnell). Meanwhile, Deputy Chief Madeline Wuntch needs Captain Holt's help with a job recommendation

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After a sleepless night, Leonard breaks his room-mate agreement with Sheldon. Howard makes preparations to go on a flight to the International Space Station and enlists Raj's help to ensure he gets a cool astronaut nickname

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon uses his holidays to help Amy in her biology lab, but moans about the menial jobs he is given - until she asks him to dissect a brain. Penny grows curious about Leonard's attitude to marriage when Bernadette asks Howard to sign a pre-nuptial agreement

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy try to eliminate stress from the planning of their wedding by applying mathematics to the process. Meanwhile, Raj 'breaks up' with Howard after realising that his best friend is actually damaging his confidence

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Howard plan respective birthday celebrations for Amy and Halley. A letter from his brother makes Leonard feel anxious about his own lack of accomplishments. The series takes a mid-season break until the new year.

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna and Ethan lock horns over recent events, and Leela is confused as to why Joel is so upset with them looking after Donna-Marie, but her and Peri stick by their decision

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: In an attempt to bond with Sheldon, George Sr takes the boys on a road trip to see the Space Shuttle launch. Meanwhile, Mary, Missy and Meemaw have a girls' weekend at the salon. Narrated by Jim Parsons

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: Dara Ó Briain gets visibly frustrated with John Kearns, Sarah Millican does something clever with her hand, Fern Brady and Munya Chawawa look for their first wins

programme.title: Made in Chelsea: Corsica
programme.desc: Liv confronts Yas about Tristan, newly-single Sam is playing with fire, and Harvey returns to the island to hear the news about Willow and Miles

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on the Eurovision Song Contest, Beat the Chasers, The Queen's Platinum Jubilee Celebration, Lovestruck High, The Repair Shop, Drag Me to Hell, and ITV News coverage of the Jubilee pudding

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A look back at the times when what started as great chemistry in the studio ended in dating disaster, reliving memorable arguments and cringeworthy moments, including bisexual Leah from the third series, who brought her pet dog Kush to the studio to help her pick her partner. There is also a reunion between Cathy from Hertfordshire and her date Andy

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A 71-year-old beekeeper is looking for a man with a naughty side to his nature, and a 21-year-old is reluctant to venture from his house, which has dented his chances of romance. Other visitors to the restaurant include a charity shop manager who has his wedding all mapped out and a Welsh hairdresser who, after a string of failed relationships, spends the evening meeting a part-time model

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The blind lead the blind, kisses are stolen, and the guys see how many pencils they can secretly fit into pockets

programme.title: Impractical Jokers
programme.desc: The guys lose their imaginary wives, pitch stupid inventions and receive hugs of forgiveness. There is sweet revenge involving an angry brother and a human pinata

programme.title: Made in Chelsea: Corsica
programme.desc: Liv confronts Yas about Tristan, newly-single Sam is playing with fire, and Harvey returns to the island to hear the news about Willow and Miles

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay concludes his visit to Zayna Flaming Grill in Redondo Beach, California, and finds more questions than answers as he tries to save the crisis-ridden restaurant from disaster. While trying to inject some much-needed flavour into the tired Mediterranean menu, the chef also encourages aunt-and-niece duo Faye and Brenda to settle their differences

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a holiday, and when Penny quits her job the duo end up spending time together. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of his girlfriend's career decision, Bernadette seeks Stuart's help in replacing one of Howard's comic books, and Howard and Raj provide Amy with some advice. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When the guys are unable to get tickets for Comic-Con, Leonard, Howard and Raj decide to buy fake passes from a stranger - but they then worry about getting caught with them. Sheldon decides to hold his own comic-book convention and searches for a suitable star guest for the event. Meanwhile, the girls take tea at a hotel but discover that maturity is over-rated. Comedy, guest starring James Earl Jones and Carrie Fisher

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre organises an amazing vow renewal ceremony for his and Rainbow's 15th anniversary to make up for the no-frills, last-minute wedding they had. However, when Rainbow's parents Alicia and Paul turn up unannounced, bombshells are dropped and old disagreements re-ignite

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Dre hurts himself playing basketball right before his 40th birthday and hands the planning of his big party over to his hip young assistant. Rainbow and Ruby face off over who can get Dre the best gift, and the kids try to figure out what present to give their father. Comedy, starring Anthony Anderson

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: An opportunity for Dilly to find out more about her rival presents itself. Tony's friendship with Rafe encourages him to make a change

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie finally admits to Scott that she has been struggling, Peri discovers that Donna-Marie is staying at the gym, and it all becomes too much for Ethan

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay uses his wealth of experience in the restaurant business to help struggling hotels, motels and B&Bs across America. After identifying the most pressing issues at each location, he puts the owners and staff to work as he attempts to save their establishments from disaster. His first stop is Coeur d'Alene, Idaho, where the Roosevelt Inn is more than $1million in debt - and to make matters worse, the owner's wife has had enough

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: To appease his mother, who worries that he might be lonely, Sheldon employs the techniques described in a self-help book from the library in an attempt to make a friend

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Meemaw comes to babysit when Sheldon's dad is rushed to the emergency room, but while she is sleeping the kids 'borrow' their grandmother's car and make their own way to hospital

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When an Internal Affairs investigator reveals there may be a mole in the precinct, Peralta and Holt must find out who it is before Deputy Chief Wuntch gets wind of the situation. Jeffords and Diaz visit a silent disco to uncover leads for their new drug task force

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta hits it off with Sophia, a woman he meets in a bar, only to find out she is the defence attorney representing a perpetrator he is trying to put behind bars. Diaz pressures Santiago to stand as a union rep, while Gina and Boyle try to move on from their relationship. Eva Longoria (best known as Desperate Housewives' Gaby) joins the cast

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. Meanwhile, the Dunphys can't decide whether Luke is trustworthy enough to be left home alone. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny is not happy when Gloria hires a male nanny and it turns out Jay isn't that keen either. Phil is worried about his dad Frank, and embarks on a mission to help him get his groove back, while Pepper pops by to plan Mitch and Cam's wedding, but when talk turns to unicorns, the pair attempt to rein their pal in. Nathan Lane guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard angers the university - and the entire physics community - when he gives an embarrassing interview. Amy and Bernadette bond over having to hide their success from Sheldon and Howard. Ira Flatow and Regina King guest star

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: As Sheldon stresses out about picking a wedding date, Amy tries to convince him that he has a more laid-back side. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart compete to win the heart of Bernadette's new colleague Ruchi. Swati Kapila guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy take a train ride to the Napa Valley with Howard and Bernadette on Valentine's Day, while Leonard and Penny head to the vets when they volunteer to look after Raj's dog. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin's wealthy brother Curtis makes a surprise visit, creating chaos in the Butlers' lives. Dave and Gemma run into challenges while trying to declutter their home

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: When Dave's job requires him to mediate a feud between two wealthy brothers, Calvin tries to help but winds up complicating the process

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil, Jay and Luke wage war against three generations of Thorpes, including Phil's arch- rival Gil. Mitch and Cam ask Claire to collect Lily from school - but forget to mention the outbreak of head lice - and Gloria chaperones a field trip, giving her cause to worry about Manny's lack of self-confidence

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is mightily annoyed after organising the school's most successful fundraiser, only for Spanish teacher Senor Kaplan to steal his thunder. Husband-to-be Mitchell, on the other hand, can't make up his mind about his old college pal Wendy, who is now his new boss, and Phil wants to impress daughter Haley, who has agreed to accompany him to the annual real estate banquet

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Though still heartbroken over Sophia, Jake's spirits are lifted when the squad is invited to a Homeland Security counter-terrorism training simulation. Gina performs a psychological test on Holt, while Santiago and Diaz compete for a day off

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Peralta notices Holt is in a bad mood, he teams up with the captain's husband Kevin to find out what has gone wrong. Boyle tries to get a confession out of an elderly bank-robbery suspect (played by Happy Days creator Garry Marshall), who pretends to be frail and adorable whenever Santiago and Diaz are around

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard devise a contest to decide whether Sheldon or Kripke should get Professor Rothman's vacant corner office. Meanwhile, Penny receives the gift of a painting from Amy to celebrate their friendship, but discreetly tries to dispose of it with help from Bernadette

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon refuses to get his hair cut as his regular barber is in a coma - a solitary change that causes chaos in the rest of his well-ordered life. Meanwhile, Howard undergoes a gruelling Nasa training programme in Houston, Texas, meaning he can only communicate with Bernadette via the internet

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy subject their friends to a series of secret tests to find out who is most qualified to act as best man and maid of honour at their wedding. Penny realises her true feelings about her friendship with Amy

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon kicks Amy out of the apartment so that he can have some 'alone time' to work, she and Leonard bond during a series of science experiments. Bert the geologist replaces Howard in his band Footprints on the Moon, and Sheldon finds Penny to be a surprising source of scientific inspiration. Laurie Metcalf and Brian Posehn guest star

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sally fears John Paul might not be ready to go to another night at The Loft, and Sienna assures Ethan she didn't want to tear that family apart and she's told Rafe everything

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped

Greg Davies hosts, ably assisted by Alex Horne

programme.title: Made in Chelsea: Corsica

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A look back at the times that the unique dating show has broken new ground, featuring stories from across the spectrum of gender and sexuality. There is also a catch-up with Lauren Harries, celebrated transsexual woman and the first celebrity to appear in a pod, and Josh, who was on the third series, to find out if he is still a virgin

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Thirty-four-year-old plumber Jamie hasn't had a proper girlfriend for almost 10 years. His date, Leigh, is seeking someone muscley and good with his hands. Shelly is a 57-year-old personal trainer who has been single for seven years. Her date is David, a 61-year-old retired firefighter who's been single for four years. Father-of-two Nathan has had a successful career in sales. His date Lisa seeks someone 'nicer' than the guys she usually dates. Last into the restaurant is 27-year-old steampunk enthusiast Joe. His date is 29-year-old Jess, who used to work at the Black Country Living Museum

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: The duo visit another planet to purchase wiper fluid and witness an annual event where the local populace commits crimes for one night without consequence. Jerry and Summer work on their father-daughter relationship, but his lack of employment keeps coming up

programme.title: Teenage Euthanasia
programme.desc: When George W Bush Senior High School's hologram teachers go on strike, Pete, Trophy and Baba have to pick up their slack. To Annie's horror, Trophy is now her sex ed teacher

programme.title: Made in Chelsea: Corsica
programme.desc: As the holiday comes to a close, everyone is reeling from the revelation that Yas and Sam have feelings for each other, and most of the group are avoiding them

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three restaurants he helped that were among the biggest challenges he faced, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he meets sisters Rita and Lisa to see if they have continued serving fresh instead of frozen food at Boston's La Galleria 33, before heading to the Olde Hitching Post in Hanson, Massachusetts, to discover whether controlling owner Tom has kept his promise and handed over the reins to his daughter Andrea. Finally, Gordon goes back to the Prohibition gastro pub in Everett, Washington, to catch up with owner Rishi and learn if she has ditched belly-dancing in favour of running her business

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy take a train ride to the Napa Valley with Howard and Bernadette on Valentine's Day, while Leonard and Penny head to the vets when they volunteer to look after Raj's dog. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard's purchase of a dining-room table causes Sheldon to re-evaluate his life. Meanwhile, Howard is offered the chance to go back to the International Space Station, and Bernadette struggles to decide whether to encourage him. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Melissa Rauch

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Rainbow accidentally finds out from one of her colleagues at the hospital that Dre never had the vasectomy he supposedly scheduled a few years back, so she decides to take steps to see if he'll come clean about it and tell her the truth

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: Rainbow reconnects with her college friends on social media and invites them over for an elaborate dinner party to impress them. On the night, Dre learns some new facts about his wife's past, and the kids decide to create their own reality show by documenting the party

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Goldie finally admits to Scott that she has been struggling, Peri discovers that Donna-Marie is staying at the gym, and it all becomes too much for Ethan

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Sienna and Ethan lock horns over recent events, and Leela is confused as to why Joel is so upset with them looking after Donna-Marie, but her and Peri stick by their decision

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits the allegedly haunted Cambridge Hotel in New York, run by former military man John Imhof and his wife Tina. John runs the business like a dictatorship - an approach that is upsetting staff and sending guests straight for the exits. Will the chef be able to use his experience in the restaurant business to save this struggling establishment from disaster?

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gordon Ramsay heads to Windsor, Vermont, on a mission to boost the fortunes of the Juniper Hill Inn, which may look impressive, but smells of raw sewage owing to a plumbing problem. After meeting the B&B's wealthy owner Robert Dean II, the chef uncovers some shocking treatment toward staff and realises he will need something approaching a miracle to save this business from disaster

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: The youngster fears solid food after choking on a sausage, and also discovers his first comic book. Iain Armitage stars

programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.desc: When Calvin is honoured by the Chamber of Commerce for the positive impact his business has had on the community, he hopes to finally gain the approval of his mother, Marilyn

programme.title: Modern Family

Phil spends most of his time with his magician heroes - neglecting Claire in the process - and Mitch runs into an ex-boyfriend he dumped by e-mail, although it all seems fine when he invites Mitch and Cam to his bachelor party

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

However, Peralta and Santiago get sidetracked chasing a criminal, and Jeffords struggles to officiate at the ceremony. Comedy, guest starring Sandra Bernhard and Nick Cannon

programme.title: Black-ish

programme.title: Black-ish
programme.desc: When teenager Zoey goes through a rebellious phase by pushing the boundaries her parents have set for her and acting up. Dre wants to lay down the law, but Rainbow insists on taking a softer approach, just as her own mother did with her

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Devon County Show, where she discovers the secret of home-made handscrub and learns about beekeeping and making beeswax candles. She also tries her hand at crafting jewellery in silver clay - an ideal way of making unusual but inexpensive gifts

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ben Hillman helps Marianne and Paul, who want a holiday home on a golf resort around the stunning Mar Menor in Murcia, Spain, on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A couple of bike lovers launch a new cycling business in Spain, while in France, a motorhome rental business deals with a busy day of bookings

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Cockermouth, Cumbria, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet blacksmith Jon, who spent many years working on fairgrounds. At the valuation, independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan reckons there's rich pickings to be made from railway memorabilia

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien continue their mission to repurpose old cast-offs into cash, making an extraordinary find from a Dutch designer in accountant Debbie's lean-to

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: After the detectives' hard work, a person visits the home of a relative she didn't know existed, and who surprisingly lives just 10 minutes' from her own house. On another case, the hunters experience a strange sense of déjà vu when they trace heirs to the estate of a woman they have met before, and their search uncovers the remarkable history of Thames bargemen. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates are divulged

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Carmarthenshire, at the School House B&B, owned by eco-friendly married couple Jayne and Ian Hall-Edwards, who hope that their environmental approach will impress their guests. At dinner, Ian reveals that his hosting skills might not be up to scratch and eyebrows are raised at straight-talking colleagues Jo and Neil. At breakfast, assumptions are made of businessman Raj

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey. On arrival, guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but Raj is shocked to find breakfast is not included

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Leafy Suburban B&B in Northwood, Hertfordshire, where the guests spend the afternoon taking a swing at some golfing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Wellington Inn, Hertfordshire, where Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach, cleansing the aura of the rooms and encouraging guests to feel the vibe

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The School House B&B is first and host Jayne Hall-Edwards takes guests back to basics over her green policy. Next, Neil Chidzey and Jo Goodwin from Cathedral 73 challenge their guests over costings

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Barbara and Stephen have had 20 happy years in their Victorian riverside cottage in Surrey, but with retirement looming, they are undecided what to do next. Stephen loves their home, while Barbara dreams of starting afresh in a new home - where she would need a separate room for her drum kit. Phil Spencer comes up with a few options should they decide to up sticks, while Kirstie Allsopp is full of ideas allowing Barbara to get out her sticks. Will they decide to stay or sell?

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: A couple of giant otters give birth to four pups after losing their first litter a few months ago. However, dad Tarubu need to step up and become more responsible - especially after leaving one of the little ones outside late at night. Red river hog Kya is being bullied by her triplet sisters. Losing weight and dangerously fragile, she will need to build up her strength and fight back if she is to survive. Keepers worry about batagur turtle Donatello, who is off his food and swimming at an odd angle

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Karin, who has mobility problems, is looking for a canine companion and the sanctuary think Harlie the Maltese might be the right fit. German shepherd Seth meets Sheppy

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits Sue and Martin who set out to renovate two 16th and 18th-century barns in 1999. Without conventional plans, surveys and specifications the project was delayed a number of times. The original deadline of Christmas 2000 came and went and by September 2002 the build was still not finished. Kevin returns two decades later to see if the house is finally complete

programme.title: Dunkirk: The Forgotten Heroes
programme.desc: The untold story of what happened after the Dunkirk evacuation, told by the men who were there and using recently declassified secret documents. Following the evacuation, tens of thousands of British troops were still left in France, fighting for their lives. The 51st Highland Division were ordered to fight on against the Hitler's war machine and now, almost 80 years later, the only remaining survivors of that Division tell their extraordinary story for the first time

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The staff of King's College Hospital reflect on the different ways in which people deal with physical and emotional pain as they treat a new batch of patients. Ahmed, 28, dislocated his shoulder during a game of American football and grits his teeth as a doctor slots it back into place. Meanwhile, 24-year-old Lee is living with Behcet's disease, a condition that affects his nervous system and causes pain so severe he passes out, and father-of-four Simon, 30, has been found unconscious at the bottom of a stairwell and it emerges he hasn't eaten for days following a relationship break-up

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Sarah, 35, arrives at King's College Hospital concerned that a brain tumour she first had as a teenager has returned. Helen, 47, is worried about her baby son James, who was born with a hole in his heart and one kidney, and has been vomiting since the morning, while 28-year-old Wayne seeks treatment for knife wounds to his leg after he tried to stop someone stealing his girlfriend's phone

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Charlie has life-threatening injuries after coming off his dirt bike from a great height. The heli-medics race to treat him as a matter of great urgency. Worried parents watch on as medics treat their five-year-old child who is having seizures

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Incidents involving the West Midlands Ambulance Service at night, including a fight in a fast food restaurant, and a woman who has fallen while carrying her four-month-old grandson

programme.desc: The staff of King's College Hospital reflect on the different ways in which people deal with physical and emotional pain as they treat a new batch of patients. Ahmed, 28, dislocated his shoulder during a game of American football and grits his teeth as a doctor slots it back into place. Meanwhile, 24-year-old Lee is living with Behcet's disease, a condition that affects his nervous system and causes pain so severe he passes out, and father-of-four Simon, 30, has been found unconscious at the bottom of a stairwell and it emerges he hasn't eaten for days following a relationship break-up

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt discovers why some fruits are hairier than others, while Kate Quilton learns what's the difference between single and double cream. Plus, Briony May Williams examines the science of canned food and it can last so long

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enters the single-cake class at the Devon County Show, and hopes to win over the judges with her own Caribbean-inspired recipe. However, it is a fellow competitor's beetroot cake that ends up raising their eyebrows

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas shows five properties to Greater Manchester couple Sandra and Robert, who want a holiday home on Spain's Costa Blanca with plenty of storage space for their bikes and located within a short walk to the beach

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Guest-house owners in Spain hope their music event will not attract the local police. In France, a motorhome rental business deals with damaged vehicles and the owners of a holiday village in Portugal deal with an unfortunate leak

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien are in Surrey, where they visit a collector of Kawasaki motorbikes

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Dumfries and Galloway, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet Alan, who works in the forestry business. Henry decides to give four bar stools a dayglo makeover, while Simon transforms two old sheep shearer seats into an extraordinary bench

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers investigate the life and work of a Glaswegian author who had lost all contact with his family, and take a trip to the home of a newspaper man from Norwich and uncover a previously unknown pension pay out of £30,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Vale of Berkeley Guest House in Gloucestershire, where owners Harri and Claire Chiba hope to prove that their establishment offers the best value for money. However, two guests from rival B&Bs have an issue with the no-frills toilet, and another places a tricky request for 'anaemic toast' at the breakfast table

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to Artist Residence in Penzance, Cornwall, where proprietors Justin and Charlie hope to impress their rivals with a pottery class. However, one pair decide their room is too modern for their tastes, a duo are shocked to find hair in a shower filter and one guest seems underwhelmed by breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host are Alec and Craig Coleman, who open the doors to the Edenfield Guest House in Blackpool and invite their fellow B&B owners to rate their establishment. However, on arrival one of the guests and his wife discover stains on the bedspread, while others feel the 'award-winning' food is not up to scratch

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the New Inn, Portland, Dorset, for the fourth day of the competition, where hosts Stacey and Spencer Cullum introduce their guests to a typical island activity - sandcastle building. Meanwhile, Claire Chiba quizzes Stacey about her breakfast hamper and says she is alienating customers, before Harri Chiba tells Justin that his B&B is too 'manufactured'

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. Two contestants attempt to explain away their negative feedback, and one contender finds herself unable to hold back her frustration, before the winner of the competition is revealed

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Charles family in Birmingham, who are split as to whether they should sell their house, which has a loft that does not meet building regulations, an out-of-date kitchen and cracks in the walls. Phil goes house-hunting in the city's swankiest postcode and Kirstie shops for some paint, leaving Carla and Richard to decide whether to sell up or renovate

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Chester's alpha male lion Iblis has not fathered any cubs for the past eight years. The keepers worry that he is lacking in confidence and hope that offering the king and his pride a larger new habitat will turn him into a more commanding ruler. But things do not go quite as planned. Territorial disputes among the male vampire crabs have resulted in a bloodbath, so night-time cameras are set up to determined the catch the culprit, affable Andean bear Bernie has been banished to the next-door paddock by his grumpy mate Lima and pygmy marmoset Baldrick needs to stand up to the lion tamarins sharing his quarters

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Pete and Hernando are smitten with Tibetan spaniel mix Baxter, but are worried their picky Chihuahua Bruno will not approve. Doctor Patrick considers offering Buster, a chilled senior red cattle dog, a retirement home

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: My Floating Home
programme.desc: South African-born Linda, her husband Mark and Coco the cat share a one-bedroom floating home on Tagg's Island in Hampton, Surrey. It's an idyllic location, but their home is also their workplace and it's starting to feel a bit cramped. The couple want to stay put in their exclusive location, so Linda has hatched an ambitious plan to buy the boat next door and do it up all by herself. It's a huge challenge and it remains to be seen whether enthusiasm and passion will be enough to get the job done

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Dennis and Karen have long dreamed of living in the wilderness and in 2013 finally bought their perfect bush block in Clarence, a tiny pocket of the spectacular Blue Mountains, west of Sydney. Bushfires are an ongoing threat and designing a house to withstand them is a challenge. For Dennis, an engineer, the answer is obvious - a house made of steel. So he sets about refurbishing seven giant shipping containers into his and Karen's new home. Peter Maddison monitors his progress

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: The presenter finds out about mixing sex and eroticism with food and weight gain, meeting two British mothers who have built a following from fetish videos. In Florida, Alice meets two leaders in the fat-fetish porn world, breaking boundaries on their mission to fly the flag for feedism

Elsewhere, a drink-related fall has left 53-year-old John with a head injury, and barman Ross, 31, needs treatment for a fractured eye socket following an alcohol-fuelled night out

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: In Birmingham, a woman has crashed a car into a pub and the force of the impact with the building's front wall has left her saying that she cannot breathe

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The return of the series uncovering secrets behind mass-produced food. Matt Tebbutt finds out why the shelf life for a vegetable stir-fry mix is so short, Jimmy Doherty uncovers the sweet secret of how ice lolly makers get such perfect layers in a rocket lolly and Kate Quilton travels to Portugal to discover just what piri-piri is

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp demonstrates how to create handmade and personalised gifts. She learns about sugarcraft and perfume-making, and also receives a lesson in the art of designing Victorian-style silhouettes

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired pair Dawn and Les from Basingstoke, Hampshire, want to relocate to sunny south-east Cyprus, where they're looking for a townhouse or bungalow that all four generations of their family can enjoy. The couple used to be leaders in the Scouts and the Brownies, so Jonnie Irwin has to work hard to earn his house hunting badge, as he comes up with five properties for their £100,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close, the Brits abroad reflect on a strange summer. In Spain, a guest house tries to tempt Spanish visitors with local cuisine and a cycling retreat wins some much-needed business, while a Portuguese holiday village takes delivery of a massive new centrepiece

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Dumfries and Galloway, where they find an electric organ and a vintage oil dispenser in barns that are brimming with junk

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet Tamara, whose family have been farming there for nearly a century. Simon has ambitious plans to turn a pile of old slate into an unusual lamp, while Henry sets his heart on upcycling the seat from an old pony and trap

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A firm traces heirs to the £500,000 estate of a burlesque dancer who performed at Soho's Windmill club throughout the Second World War, while another case uncovers a family's links to a comedy star's radio career. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at the Black Lion in Halland, East Sussex, where host Nigel Fright gets off to a shaky start when a kettle goes missing from one of the rooms. Later, he takes the guests to a salsa class, where Sherrill Tacy and Hayley Cotton are surprised by some of his dance moves

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. The proprietor tries to win his rivals round with his unique sense of humour, but tensions rise when the contestants go for a spin on a go-kart track

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sherrill Tacy hosts at the Sherwood Guesthouse in New Brighton on the Wirral, and is praised for the establishment's value for money. However, there is upset when her breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and her final review is far from perfect

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Final hosts Mark and Rachael Dann welcome the contestants to the Big Bear Lodge in Shropshire. They face the tough job of trying to keep the rift between some of the guests to a minimum in their ski-themed B&B, and their afternoon activity of canoeing raises a few laughs but accusations of cheating occur when the boys begin to get competitive

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants featured throughout the week reunite to revisit the highs and lows of their various stays, and as the B&B owners confront their critics face to face, they discover what the rival parties really thought of the quality of service that they encountered. After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet James and Graham, who are unable to agree about their 17th-century cottage in the Surrey village of Cranleigh. They need more space and while Graham thinks the answer to their problem would be to sell, James fancies an extension. Kirstie has an economical plan to redesign the house, while Phil finds out what £650,000 gets you in Britain's most expensive county

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Newcomer Safi, a rare bongo antelope from the mountains of Kenya, is giving enthusiastic breeding partner Moti the runaround. Very soon the keepers realise why - it seems she may be about to give birth earlier than expected. Sunda gharial crocodiles Frank and Frankie need to have their blood tested - but taking a sample from one of the world's largest and most dangerous reptiles is easier said than done - and George the giant rat needs to have surgery after an X-ray pinpoints a huge lump of hard faeces in his stomach

programme.title: The Dog House Australia
programme.desc: Zahra and Jack adore Wolfie the Wolfhound, but their daughters are less convinced. Love is in the air when golden Labrador Chai meets Laurel and Darrell, but will Chai be ok around their wheelchairs?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets retired racehorse breeder John and his wife Helen in Dunstable. The couple met at Newbury races in 2005 and wed two years later, living together in a 17th-century farmhouse until illness struck in 2018. Helen had a catastrophic stroke, severely affecting her mobility and leaving her with aphasia, which affects her ability to communicate. Constrained by the steep stairs, narrow doorways and changes in level of their current home, John resolved to make a big change in their lives with the purchase of a nearby two-acre plot. Following the demolition of an old, dilapidated house on site, a new high-tech accessible pavilion, complete with wildlife garden, will be built in its place for £1.3million

programme.title: Rig 45: Murder at Sea
programme.desc: After the shocking events in the North Sea, the police learn that Petra's story doesn't stack up, and she faces a prison sentence. A body wearing a Benthos Oil jacket is washed ashore and Inspector Emma Marshall and her colleague Trevor Webb find a diary the in jacket that seems to belong to Petra's brother and identify the body as his. The diary mentions a hard drive, which must still be on the rig and could contain evidence of murder. Later, a worker is found unconscious and close to death, and it seems possible that events are set to be repeated. Drama, starring Andrei Alen, Ciarán McMenamin, Dmitry Vinokurov and Lisa Henni. In English and Swedish

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff nurse Graeme is attacked by a prisoner who has been brought to King's College Hospital for treatment and the team has to restrain the patient before giving him the care he needs. Father-of-two Tony, 59, is rushed in by helicopter medics following a head-on traffic collision, 85-year-old Eric arrives with ongoing stomach problems and 79-year-old Jim, who is experiencing breathing difficulties, quickly strikes up a rapport with the female staff and muses on what it means to be a gentleman

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A young man who has had a severe reaction to a recreational drug is wheeled into resus by paramedics, and senior sister Jen and the medical team face a challenge to calm their patient down so they can treat him. A 65-year-old woman is brought in by her best friends after hitting her head when she fell off a chair while playing bingo, and a 31-year-old man with multiple sclerosis is rushed in after developing a fever at home

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, as Sean Lock and Richard Ayoade take on Jon Richardson and Jessica Knappett. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join wordsmith Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while maths whizz Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Briony May Williams is in Germany to uncover why schnapps is always clear despite being made from bright, colourful fruits. Kate Quilton learns why supermarkets carry so many variations of the same herbs, while Jimmy Doherty finds out if there is any difference between soft and crusty bread rolls

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Being a huge Lamborghin fan, Yianni is thrilled to get the chance to work on a new 4x4 SUV model that the Italian car maker has brought out

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Following the work of Yianni Charalambous, car customiser for the rich and famous. In the first episode, Yianni has to get a hybrid supercar ready in under a week

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles helps adapt a house in Enfield, north London, for Eric Rivers, who is terminally ill with motor neurone disease. He, his wife Davina and three daughters require their terraced property to be altered to meet his needs and provide them with additional room, so friends, neighbours and local tradespeople rally round to complete the construction work in just nine days

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Fowey Estuary, one of Cornwall's hidden secrets, joining a friend on a boat trip to learn about the history of the area and getting a unique view of the buildings along the riverbank. He discovers the area's history of piracy, meets a family that make award-winning vodka, and makes a pancake with a wild blackberry compote and Cornish clotted cream

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: On the wild north Atlantic coast, Rick heads out to sea to go fishing for lobsters with his old friend and celebrity chef Nathan Outlaw, before helping to cook up a lobster risotto. Later, at Tresillian House near Newquay, Rick meets with head gardener John Harris to find out more about his Victorian walled garden

programme.title: Ultimate Movers
programme.desc: A crane must be moved from Bristol's Avonmouth Dock and, in Immingham, tonnes of fresh fish has to be delivered intact and on time to Grimsby's famous fish market

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Desperately short of unmarked cars, the police use a demonstration model to help catch speeding drivers. The mechanics struggle to fix a specialist vehicle with a problem, and one of the officers remembers the biggest fight of his career

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May visits California to learn about the hydrogen-fuelled Honda FCX Clarity, and Jeremy Clarkson assesses the performance of Tesla's battery-powered supercar the Roadster. Richard Hammond looks back over 50 years of British touring car racing, and singer Tom Jones is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: A former British Championship racer wants to swap his Ford Focus for a two-door sports car, and is pitched options including a Ford Mustang Coupe and a Lotus Elise

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles helps Sue Roberts, who was left with a run-down cottage near Dumfries, when her partner Barry died of a heart attack on Christmas Day 2003. programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages - with the opening episode featuring a bidding war over a mystery object, and the gang competing for a lot of occult objects and a coffin

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Dan gambles on a lot he might later regret in when the gang visits Milton Keynes, while Nat lets her heart rule her head on a sale

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team orders four new dog vehicles for the canine section. However, when they're delivered they aren't what was asked for. Meanwhile, Adam worries about pig urine getting on his skin when he fixes a 308 and the mechanics have to handle a bird strike

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. programme.desc: Racing instructor Aktar has a garage full of cars, and is going to sell them all to buy his 'forever car'. Will it be the American muscle, the German turbos or an English supercar?

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturer's already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. programme.desc: In the heart of the West Midlands, Nick Knowles and local volunteers help a Dudley family whose three children have a genetic learning disorder. The Whitehouses tried to add an extension to their house, but after living in a building site for a year it had become too much. The build has to be completed in just nine days, and plummeting sub-zero temperatures make the task even more daunting

programme.desc: The crew visits Germany to collect a multi-million-pound maintenance machine so large it will need to be loaded onto two trucks. Eric and Chris oversee a diesel-engine exchange

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the post-war British modern art movement in the seaside town of St Ives, the home for leading artists such as Barbara Hepworth and Terry Frost. At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.desc: The fortune-finding show continues in Bentwaters, with the contents of some old army bunkers exciting the bidders, while a vintage box captures Rupert's attention

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: The team tries to save the police's ailing horse wagons. An officer escapes with his life after a pursuit car is rammed by a stolen 4x4, while the mounted unit keeps the peace at one of the biggest football clashes of the year

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. programme.title: Top Gear

Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: In the heart of the West Midlands, Nick Knowles and local volunteers help a Dudley family whose three children have a genetic learning disorder. The Whitehouses tried to add an extension to their house, but after living in a building site for a year it had become too much. The build has to be completed in just nine days, and plummeting sub-zero temperatures make the task even more daunting

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

Treasures brought in to be valued include a harp that survived the French Revolution, a curious wooden item with an unexpected purpose, a diamond brooch found hidden inside a barometer and a pair of Second World War propaganda posters printed on hessian sacking

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his great American trek, following his copy of Appleton's General Guide east from Manhattan to Long Island, and visits Brooklyn to hear the story of the construction of the world's first suspension bridge. Below ground, he investigates New York City's inaugural subway, and the dangers faced by the 'sandhogs' who built it. Progressing along the Long Island Railroad to Queens, Michael takes in an ambitious engineering project and a model town built by an Irish immigrant who became one of America's richest men. Later, he heads to the island's Gold Coast, where he relives the fun of 'the roaring twenties' at Oheka Castle, and concludes this leg of his trip at the Montauk lighthouse on Long Island's eastern-most tip

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the beautiful and unique landscapes of the Lake District, beginning by meeting Cumbrians with different visions for the future of England's biggest national park. He talks to members of a campaign group trying to protect the remaining red squirrels, a traditional farmer who feels that his ancient way of life is on the point of extinction, and an 18-year-old student who runs a 1,500-acre farm

He then travels to Austria via Bratislava in Slovakia, and in Vienna he immerses himself in pre-First World War decadence. From there he heads to Salzburg, before going on to the Salzkammergut region to visit the emperor's Austrian summer residence at Bad Ischl, where in 1914 Franz Joseph I signed a declaration that changed the course of European history
